loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Edna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 110,00 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to resell like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc. Edna has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fishing and farming rice. Edna aspires to save enough money to expand her business and so that she can afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to resell like shampoo, spices, soft drinks, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anamalia

texts.en: Anamalia is a 40-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small business, a taro and yam plantation. She is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house so that her family can have better living conditions. Anamalia will use the loan to buy roofing sheets, cement, nails, timber and iron roofing. Anamalia joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy roofing sheets, cement, nails, timber and iron roofing.

loans.name: Joebima

texts.en: Joebima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 through NWTF to buy items to resell like shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, chips, etc. for her general store business. Joebima has been in this business for 11 years. Joebima earns more income from her buy-and-sell charcoal and farming rice businesses. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store, buy-and-sell charcoal and rice businesses. Joebima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to resell like shampoo, noodles, soft drinks, chips, etc.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Laarni requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Laarni would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: El señor Emilio Amaya Tarrico  tiene 30 años de edad es soltero, sin hijos, estudio hasta nivel primario, los escasos recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a continuar sus estudios, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven, en los chacos ayudando en las  cosechas, con sus ahorros se compró una moto con la cual se dedica al servicio de moto taxi, trabaja todos los días,  actualmente vive en casa de sus parientes no paga alquiler solo les ayuda a pagar agua y luz, en el tiempo que lleva trabajando, con sus ahorros ya se compró un lote urbano en ivirgarzama, siempre soñó tener casa propia,  es por esto que solicita un crédito para empezar a construir y además independizarse; y así  empezar a  hacer su casita donde ya pueda vivir y ampliar poco a poco y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Emilio Amaya Tarrico is 30 years old, single, without kids and has an elementary school level education.  His parents' limited resources prevented him from continuing his studies.  He began to work from a very young age helping with crops.  With his savings, he purchased a motorcycle which he uses in his work as a moto-taxi driver.  He works everyday and at the moment, he lives in his family's home in which he pays no rent but helps them pay for utilities.  

In the time he has been working, he has used his savings to purchase an urban lot in Ivirgarzama.  He has always dreamed of having his own home which is why he is requesting a loan to begin the construction and become independent.  With this, he will begin to make his home where he will be able to live, grow and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: build his home.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She buys and sells young coconuts in the Philippines, a business she has had for five years.

Lilian has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more young coconuts to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace, a 26-year-old married mother of three children who are in school, works hard to provide for her family. For the past three years she has been buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and earns additional income from operating a general store and farming vegetables.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan to purchase additional charcoal to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 37 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto sus 4 hijos.
Diana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 10 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de su conviviente en la preparación y venta del carbón.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que les deja.
Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia y cubrir los gastos diarios de su hogar.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento.
Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto cuenta de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto de 600 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones.
texts.en:
Diana is 37 years old, she is married and she lives in her own house with her 4 children.
Diana engages in making and selling charcoal from recycled wood from neighboring sawmills. She started more than 10 years ago, and to today she has been counting on her life partner’s support with the making and selling charcoal.
She thinks her activity to be profitable for the good income she earns.
She decided starting her own activity because she needed to count on an economic income to support her family and to pay for her household’s daily expenses.
Therefore, considering the good profits and the income she earns, she wants to keep on running her activity as this is her only source of income.
This will be her first Kiva loan, and she counts on a small loan so that she will achieve her goals. On the other hand, she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.
The 600 PEN she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of the basic materials she needs to make charcoal.

loans.use: To buy recycle wood and oil to make charcoal.

loans.name: Andres Rufino

texts.es:
Andres tiene 25 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con la compañera y con los hijos Amy de 7 años y Valentin de 3 años en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Andres se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz en pocas cantidades ya que recien esta empezando con este negocio. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es trabajar duro para tener dienro para construir la casa, en los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte sobre todo Boly Bool.
texts.en:
Andres, 25, is in a common-law marriage and he has 2 children.  He lives with his partner and their children: Amy, aged 7, and Valentin, aged 2, in the village of Terrenal, which is in the canton of Pueblo Viejo in the Los Rios province.  

Andres is a member of the communal bank "Terrenal," which meets in the village of Terrenal in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  He works in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Andres cultivates corn and rice in small quantities, because he recently started with this business.  With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies such as organic and chemical fertilizers, and insecticides to avoid pests and diseases.  He makes his purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

Andres' dream is to work hard so that he can earn money to build a house.  In his spare time, he enjoys playing sports, particularly volleyball.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure and insecticides to prevent pests and disease

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
Véronique fait partie du groupe  Tujinama  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 53 ans et est mariée à  Salvator, un agriculteur.

Elle fait le commerce de  charbon de bois.

Elle est à son dix-neuvième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et  acheter beaucoup de sacs de charbon de bois (5 sacs) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait faire le commerce de boutique(haricot, riz,savon,...)
texts.en:
Veronique is a member of the Tujinama group. She lives in Gitega. She is 53 years old and is married to Salvator, a farmer.
She sells charcoal. She is on her 19th loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy a lot of charcoal (five bags) for resale in order to earn more.

In the years to come, she would like to open a store (to sell beans, rice, soap etc).

loans.use: to bolster her capital and buy a lot of charcoal (five bags) for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru:
Мухараму 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж плотник. Мухарам является основной кормилицей семьи. Она более 10 лет занимается купле продажей женской одежды на местном рынке. Мухарам покупает товар с других районов оптом и продает в розницу на местном рынке. Мухарам с бизнесом справляется сама. Она должна купить товар для нового летного сезона, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки товара для нового сезона. 
Это 16 цикл кредитования Мухарама и она имеет положительную кредитную историю. Этот займ поможет ей расширить ассортимент товара и таким образом увеличить доход. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muharam is 42 years old. She is married and raising three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Muharam is the main breadwinner in the family. For over 10 years, she has been buying and reselling women’s clothing at the local market. Muharam buys her merchandise wholesale from other regions and sells retail at the local market. Muharam manages her business by herself. She needs to buy merchandise for the summer season but lacks the funds. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 TJS to buy merchandise for the new season.

This is Muharam's 16th loan cycle. She has a good credit history. This loan will allow her to expand her selection of goods and thus increase her revenues. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: El Sr. Saúl tiene 27 años,  el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Santo Corazón,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Saúl va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de papa   y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Saúl enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene , una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad. Directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Saúl is 27. He works in agriculture and plants a variety of vegetables such as potato and yucca on his land located in the community of Santo Corazon. This is his first loan with the institution. Saúl will use it for the purchase of potato seeds and items he needs to prepare the land. He needs this loan in order to have the resources for sowing and to subsist. He confronts challenges such as the inclement climate which often ruins the seedlings. He will use the profit from this loan in order to improve his and his family's quality of life. He is responsible for all of the household costs. He is a responsible and hard-working person, and is grateful to the institution for this support, since this job is his only source of income. Once he harvests his products he sells them in the community market, directly to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potato.

loans.name: Rionny

texts.es: El señor Rionny es una persona trabajadora y responsable actualmente vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos a los cuales sacrificándose de sol a sol mantiene, trabajando en los pocos cultivos que él tiene pero no le alcanza el tiempo para poder cosechar a tiempo sus cultivos ya que mantener el chaco no es fácil, tiene que estar madrugando para poder hacer el chaqueo y la limpieza, ahí es donde el tiempo no le espera y sus cultivos se pasan de su época y ya es bueno para cosecharlos,  por tal motivo el señor Rionny solicita un crédito para que se pueda comprar una motorozadora y una moto fumigadora para que pueda trabajar más rápidamente y le alcance el tiempo para que pueda cosechar sus productos y así no tenga perdidas, de esa manera tambien a sus hijos y a su esposa no les faltara alimentación, ropa,etc. además se dedicara un poco más de tiempo a estar con su familia lo que antes no podía hacer.
texts.en: Rionny is a hard-working and responsible person who lives with his wife and children. He sacrifices himself from sunrise to sunset for them. He works very hard, but he does not have the time to harvest his crops on time because maintaining the farm is not easy. He has to get up at first light in order to care for the land. Time waits for no one, and the crops mature; it is now time to harvest. For this reason, Rionny is requesting a loan so that he can purchase an electric machete and a motorized fumigator so that he can work more quickly and have enough time to harvest all his crops without any losses. This will mean that his children and wife will not lack for food, clothing, etc. He will also be able to spend a bit more time with his family, which he was unable to do before.

loans.use: to buy an electric machete and a motorized fumigator.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: La Sra. Jovita tiene 50 años dos hijos de las  edades de 9 y 12 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en localidad de la Guardia de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Jovita utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la  Sra. Jovita va a utilizar los beneficios para comprar material de construcción para la construcción de un ambiente en su casita,  su deseo de la  Sra. Jovita es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Jovita is 50 years old and has two children, aged 9 and 12. She makes her living selling food in her stall, which is located in the Guardia section of the city of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with this institution. Jovita will use the loan to buy wholesale ingredients to make food, like potatoes, rice, and noodles. That way, she will improve her sales and increase the capital for her business. Her reason for seeking this loan is because she lacks the capital to buy her ingredients. 

Jovita will use her profits to buy construction materials to build a new space in her house. Jovita's wish is to grow her business. She is a hard-working woman and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support it provides her in giving her this loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Armando sigue con la misma actividad de la agricultura, plantando papa, yuca y variedad de hortalizas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para el preparado de la tierra ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en: Armando is still farming potatoes, cassava, and a variety of vegetables. He says his previous loan went quite well. He used the first loan to buy seeds. He is currently requesting a loan to buy seeds for growing potatoes and to prepare the field for planting because there's a lot of demand for the crop at this time.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing potatoes and to prepare his field.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El  sr. Juan Carlos es casado, tiene dos hijos,  los cuales ayudan a su familia  para salir adelante, el sr. Juan Carlos se dedica a la repostería  venta de queques, y por otro lado es cerrajero, juan Carlos  necesita mucha ayuda económica para mejorar sus ingresos porque lamentablemente está atravesando una crisis insoportable ya que sus ingresos no le es suficiente para afrontar sus obligaciones, para  ello necesita mucha ayuda económica es por eso que solicita crédito para comprarse un horno industrial y torno industrial para así poder mejorar su fuente de ingreso, actualmente juan Carlos trabaja con toda su familia para sobrevivir y tener un futuro próspero.
texts.en: Juan Carlos is married and has two children who help his family a good deal. Juan Carlos makes cakes and is also a locksmith. He needs a lot of financial assistance to increase his income: he is currently going through very difficult times and his income is not enough to cover his debts. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy himself an industrial oven and an industrial drill to improve his income. At the moment Juan Carlos works together with his entire family to survive and have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and an industrial drill.

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
Flor tiene 30 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Flor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y aumentar la produccion le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Mina de Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of 30 DE NOVIMEMBRE (November 30), a Communal Bank located in Mina De Piedra, a comment of the Ventanas Cantón where people engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Flor engages in agriculture, planting corn, and in breeding livestock such as chickens and pigs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides to fight pests and plant sickness; she will also buy animal balance feed. She will buy her products in the town of Ventanas.

She dreams of buying some land to keep on planting and to increase her production. She loves Shrovetide celebrations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and animal balance feed.

loans.name: Silvana Lourdes

texts.es:
Silvana tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Silvana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas , además alimento para los animales como balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un vehiculo para el trabajo le gusta tejer ropa de lana y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Silvana is 35 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Mina de Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of "30 de Noviembre" (November 30), a Communal Bank located in Mina De Piedra, a comment of the Ventanas Cantón where people engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Silvana engages in agriculture, planting corn, and in breeding livestock such as chickens and pigs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides as well as animal balance feed. She will buy her products in the town of Ventanas.

She dreams of buying a vehicle for her job. She likes weaving woolen clothes and spend time with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and animal balance feed.

loans.name: Vicente Agustin

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 26 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Vicente se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para construir la casa le gusta mucho hacer deporte sobre todo jugar indor.
texts.en:
Vicente is 26 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage and he has one child. He lives with his partner and child in Mina de Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of “30 de Noviembre” (November 30), a Communal Bank located in Mina De Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón where people engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Vicente engages in agriculture, planting corn, and in breeding livestock such as chickens. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides to fight pests and plant sickness; he will also buy animal balance feed. He will buy his products in the town of Ventanas.

He dreams of buying some land to build his house. He loves practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Flor Senobia

texts.es:
Flor tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Flor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos . Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas ,además alimento para los animales.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando le gusta ayudar al progino en tareas comunitarias como limpiar la capilla.
texts.en:
Flor is 36 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has two children. She lives with her partner and children in Mina de Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of “30 de Noviembre” (November 30), a Communal Bank located in Mina De Piedra, a comment of the Ventanas Cantón where people engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Flor engages in agriculture, planting corn, and in breeding livestock such as chickens. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides as well as animal balanced feed. She will buy her products in the town of Ventanas.

She dreams of buying some land to keep on planting. She likes helping others in community projects like cleaning the chapel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides as well as animal balanced feed.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is a 65-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu (giant taro) and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Mareta has requested a loan to buy taro root, a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water gallon.  She became a member of SBPD in 2013. With her profits, Mareta hopes to support her family.

loans.use: to buy taro root, a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water gallon

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 48 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her three children.  To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business, which is a school supplies store in the local community. Mary Ann has been in her business for years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She is very supportive to her children as she works hard to handle all difficulties in life to raise their living standards.

Recently, Mary Ann has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC which she will use to purchase notebooks, pens, paper, stationery and  crayons to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens, paper, stationery and  crayons to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva has been raising pigs for two years and  earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
Jose tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene un hijo vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales  como  cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, además balanceado que es alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener dienro para salir de viaje para ir a galapagos.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage and he has one child. He lives with his partner and child in Mina de Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of “30 de Noviembre” (November 30), a Communal Bank located in Mina De Piedra, a community of the Ventanas Cantón where people engage in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Jose engages in agriculture, planting corn, and in breeding livestock such as pigs. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy products such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides as well as animal balanced feed. He will buy his products in the town of Ventanas.

He dreams of earning enough money to travel to Galapagos Islands.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and animal balanced feed.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, aged 39, is married and has four children. She and her husband help each other to raise their four children. She is dedicated to a rice farming business while her husband is a teacher in a primary school, not far from their home. Together, they can make a net income of $4.50 per day to cover their daily costs. 

Since the rain is coming quickly this season, Sim needs some farm inputs to apply to her rice crop. Due to the lack of capital, she is taking out a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase fertilizers and hire laborers to plow and transplant her rice. Through the loan support, she hopes to maintain high rice production and make more income to meet her family’s living needs. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a few pieces of farmland to increase her farm outputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and hire laborers to plow and transplant her rice.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa is a 54-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small business which is a taro and banana plantation. Sa is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a water gallon, bush-knives, chemicals and taro root. Sa joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a water gallon, bushknives, chemicals and taro root and to pay school fees

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan so she can buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Linda dreams that her business will grow strong and prays for God's strength and guidance. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy's twelfth loan cycle. She used her loan for her mineral water, food vending and direct selling business. Her income from her loan helped her in raising her nine children. She was able to send her children to school and her family's needs are met. As a widow, she is working hard to continuously provide for her family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain the education expenses and daily needs of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy dreams that her business will continue to flourish and prays for physical strength so that she can continue to support her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and gallons of mineral water needed to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Glenda has been in this business for five years. Glenda earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny's main source of income comes from his farm business where he plants and harvests corn for sale. He is 23 years old, married with one child and lives in Tugas, Tangub City. He has been working in farming for more than six years, earning an amount of 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Manny joined GDMPC. He is now  requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with four school-aged and adult-aged children. Elisa is 49 years old, residing at Migpange, Bonifacio, Philippines. 

Elisa is operating a business selling seafood products, including crabs, fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She's been in the business for years. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of business. 

Elisa requested a loan of PHP 19,000 from Gata Daku MPC to purchase shrimp and crabs for sale. In the future, Elisa wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp and crabs to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used for the operation materials and maintenance of her labor and delivery clinic. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Currently, she also sells slippers for additional income.

Caroline would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan that she will use for the operation materials and maintenance of her labor and delivery clinic. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Caroline dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes for good health for her whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the operation materials and maintenance of her labor and delivery clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Braulio David

texts.es:
Braulio tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Braulio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz este empezando a trabajar en un pedazo de terreno que le dio el padre para que siembre. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar maquinaria para la agricultura para que se haga menos el trabajo, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los amigos a jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Braulio is 24 years old. He is single, and he doesn't have any children. Braulio lives with his parents in the Terrenal precinct which is part of Pueblo Viejo county of the Los Ríos province.

Braulio is part of the Terrenal communal bank which is located in the Terrenal precinct of Pueblo Viejo county, which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock workers.

Braulio works in agriculture in the sowing of corn. He is starting to work a piece of land his father gave him for planting. With the loan, he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers and insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases. He makes the purchases in the city of Pueblo Viejo. 

Braulio's dream is to buy agricultural machinery so that he'll have less work. In his free time, he likes to go out with friends to play soccer.

loans.use: fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and earns additional income from a general store.

Rosita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paint, bamboo, nylon, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paint, bamboo, nylon, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mariniel

texts.en: Mariniel lives in Ozamis City with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in a private company as a collector and she helps him augment their living with her piggery. Mariniel has been doing this for more than five years to earn a living. She is borrowing a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy feed for fattening her pigs. She hopes to expand her piggery in order to have a better living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening her pigs

loans.name: Narissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Narissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal, and farming vegetables. Narissa is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Narissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ramon Darwin

texts.es:
Ramos tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Ramos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas, además balanceado y cereales para los animales. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir trabaando.
texts.en:
Ramos is 34 years old and single with no children.  He lives with his parents in the Mina de Piedra area, part of the Ventanas settlement in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the 30 de Noviembre group, located in Mida de Piedra, within the Ventanas settlement.  He is a farmer and also raises livestock.

Ramos raises corn, chickens, and pigs.

This loan will allow him to buy supplies such as fertilizer, compost, seed, balanced feed, and grains for his animals.  He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to buy some land so he can keep working.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto opened City Base Bar & Grill on March 20, 2013, with a plan to offer a great place for families to come enjoy some great food and drinks. The bar’s motto is, “Once you enjoy a cold one with us, you are one of us.” Humberto’s bar is located on San Antonio’s Southeast side near popular restaurants, a movie theatre, and shops.  

One of Humberto’s close friends informed him about Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping entrepreneurs realize their business dreams. Once Humberto applied and received his $5,450 Accion loan, he began using the money to repair and make improvements to the facility, purchase a grill, refrigerator, and flooring, and purchase merchandise.  

City Base Bar & Grill offers customers a 46-inch high-definition television with more than 200 channels, a jukebox with the latest hits, and will be the only bar in the area serving up tasty food. 

Humberto is currently working on his business website, but also utilizes social media to post pictures and messages. If you are interested in having a good time, visit his Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/citybasebarandgrill

loans.use: to repair and make improvements to the facility, purchase a grill, refrigerator, and flooring, and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Pastor Alberto

texts.es:
Pasto tiene 43 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Pasto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz este empezando a trabajar en un pedazo de terreno que le dio el padre para que siembre. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar maquinaria para la agricultura para que se haga menos el trabajo, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los amigos a jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Pastor is 43 years old. He is married, has two children, and he lives with his parents in the Terrenal precinct which is part of Pueblo Viejo county of the Los Ríos province. 

He belongs to the Terrenal communal bank, located in the precinct of Terrenal in Pueblo Viejo county, which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock laborers. 

Pastor works in agriculture, sowing corn, and he is starting to work a piece of land his father gave him to plant. With the loan, he will buy supplies like fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases. The purchases are made in the city of Pueblo Viejo.

His dream is to buy machinery so that he will have less work to do. In his free time, he likes to go out with friends to play soccer.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to prevent infestations and diseases.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

Myrna has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a motorcycle transport business.

Myrna aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Diana Liset

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 22 años, soltera y ha asumido el rol de ser madre de su pequeño que ahora tiene 1 año de edad. Terminó la secundaria y se dedicó a  trabajar para buscar la oportunidad de continuar con sus estudios pero su vida ahora gira alrededor de su hijo, pues para ella uno de los obstáculos más grandes que ha tenido que atravesar es el abandono de su pareja quien tampoco se interesa por su hijo. Diana vive con su hijo en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una ciudad que cuenta un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Sus varios atractivos turísticos acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Diana aprendió en sus años de estudiante de secundaria el arte de la fotografía, lo cual le sirvió para emprender con la instalación de un local de fotografía, sin embargo los ingresos no eran suficientes, por lo que desde hace 6 años incrementó a su actividad la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, labor que la realiza paralelamente a su negocio, exhibiendo los catálogos y productos que tiene en stock dentro del local, además cada fin de semana ella sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad para ofertar sus productos y además realizar actividad de cobranza. Los clientes de Diana en su mayoría son mujeres que también demandan otro tipo de productos como son ropa y zapatos, para lo cual Diana solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la inscripción de una cadena de ropa y zapatos por catálogo y además ropa  de temporada para exhibir y mostrar a sus clientes. Con este paso de crecimiento, Diana incrementará sus clientes y por ende sus ganancias serán mayores, esto le ayudará a darle a su hijo un mejor estilo de vida y a cubrir las necesidades básicas en su hogar. La falta de capital siempre ha sido un obstáculo para que ella pueda crecer con sus actividades comerciales, ahora tuvo la oportunidad de aplicar para su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa quienes le brindaron la confianza y agilidad en atención que ella estaba buscando. Diana estuvo muy de acuerdo con aplicar para el producto Kiva, pues está segura de que en el mundo entero pueden conocer que en el Ecuador las personas tienen un espíritu emprendedor y luchan por sus sueños a pesar de las barreras.
texts.en: Diana is a 22-year-old young woman. She is single and the mother of a young child who is one year old. She finished secondary school. She wants to work so she can find a way to continue with her education. Right now her life revolves around her child. One of the greatest obstacles that she has is the loss of her partner, who is also not interested in their child. Diana lives with her son in the town of Rio Verde de Santo Domingo, which is the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. This city has a many businesses, as it has become an inland port of exchange between the mountainous region and the coast of the country. The various tourist attractions of the city are related to the warm climate. Many national and international tourists visit here. Most of the population of the city works in business or services related to the local inhabitants or the tourists. Diane learned how to be a photographer when she was a secondary student. Now she has a business at a local photography shop. Never the less, her income isn't sufficient. So, for the last six months, she has been augmenting her income by selling cosmetics from a catalogue. She can do this while she is at the photography shop. She shows her catalogues and the products that she has in stock, while she is in the shop. Every weekend she goes door-to-door in her city selling her products and collecting payments for them. Diana's customers are mainly women that are also requesting other products such as clothes and shoes. This is why Diana is requesting this loan. She will use the money to start selling a line of clothing and shoes by catalogue. She will also buy seasonal clothes to exhibit and show to her customers. By growing her business Diane will increase her customer base with the objective of increasing her earnings. This will help her provide a better life for her child and pay for the household necessities. The lack of capital is always an obstacle for her ability to increase her business. Now she has the opportunity to apply for her first loan from the "Alternative Foundation". This Foundation has provided the confidence and flexibility that she was looking for. Diana agrees to apply for a KIVA loan. She wants the world to know that the people of Ecuador have an enterprising spirit and strive to achieve their dreams despite the barriers that they face.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in order to provide a greater variety of goods for her business.

loans.name: Edgar Luis

texts.es: Edgar, con 31 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agrícolas desde que era joven. En la actualidad, todos los días de la semana se levanta desde muy temprano en la mañana para dedicarse a laborar como jornalero en el pueblo donde reside y además está al cuidado de los cultivos de yuca y maíz que posee en un pequeño lote de tierra, de esta forma ha logrado obtener ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.  Edgar es un señor trabajador, emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está en busca de opciones que le brinden la oportunidad de mejorar su economía, por ello solicita el crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas (fungicidas, pesticidas, abonos y fertilizantes) para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha de excelente calidad, que le permita vender los productos a mejor precio e incrementar así sus ingresos. Edgar desea hacer crecer sus cultivos, que le generen una solvencia y una estabilidad económica para poder cumplir el sueño de formar una familia en un futuro cercano y así tener la posibilidad de brindarle bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 years old. He is single, and has yet to have children. He has spent all of his life in the field, where he learned to do agricultural labor since he was young. Currently he wakes up very early everyday to work as a laborer in the village where he lives. He also taking care of yuca and corn crops, and he owns a small lot of land. In this way, he has managed to earn a living to take home. 

Edgar is a hardworking and enterprising man, and he is eager to get ahead. He is always looking for options that offer the opportunity to improve his economy, which is why he's asking for a loan. He wishes to invest the loan to purchase agricultural supplies (fungicides, pesticides, manure and fertilizers) to continue taking care of his crops and to reap a harvest of excellent quality he. This way can sell the products at a better price and increase his income.

Edgar wishes to grow his crops so that he can produce solvency and economic stability to be able to fulfill his dream of starting a family in the near future, and thus be able to provide good well being and quality of life.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies (fungicides, pesticides, manure, fertilizers)

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: El señor Sebastian, es una persona de 25 años, de edad de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar hasta el bachillerato, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo, vive en una casa de tipo rustico como cuidante en el cual cuenta con servicio de luz, el domicilio se halla situado en la Comunidad de Pocona, su actividad económica es la agricultura que anualmente indica que produce los siguientes productos; papa 250 cargas, arveja (verde) 160 arrobas, Maíz (grano) 15 cargas y finalmente achojcha 240 arrobas. para lo cual el señor Sebastian y concubina señalan tener el deseo de poder superarse y mejorar su situación económica para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para la compra de insumos agrícolas de tal forma poder mejorar e incrementar la producción y de igual forma mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos mismo y de su dependiente.
texts.en: Sebastian is 25 years old and single. He has finished high school. He has a young, dependent son. He lives in a rustic house that is typical of the area. It has electricity. It is located in the community of Pocono. He is a farmer. Each year he produces the following products: 250 loads of potatoes, 160 twenty-five pound sacks of green peas, 15 loads of corn and finally 240, twenty-five pound sacks of “achojchas” (a local vegetable). Sebastian and his partner would like to get ahead and improve their economic situation. This is why they are requesting this loan. They would like to have working capital in order to purchase agricultural supplies. In this way they can improve and increase their crop production. Then they will be able to improve the quality of life for themselves and their child.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: El Sr. Apolinar vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casado, es una persona trabajadora, se dedican a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 1 Ha herencia de sus padres produce papa, haba en vaina verde y oca, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 2 de engorde y 2 lecheras. El Sr Apolinar requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico 18 cubos, quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos y le entregan en el mismo lugar. Apolinar está contento al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución porque con la compra de abono orgánico ya tiene asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y generar ingresos a futuro.
texts.en: Mr. Apolinar lives in the community of Colomi. He is 25 years old and married. He is a hardworking man. He works in agriculture. He grows crops on land that he inherited from his parents. He grows potatoes, broad green beans and oca (a root vegetable). He rotates his crops each year. He also has cattle, two that he is fattening for meat and two cows for milk. Mr. Apolinar is requesting this loan in order to purchase 18 cubics of organic fertilizer. He would like to take advantage of this time when the prices are low. They deliver the fertilizer to her site. Apolinar is happy to have the opportunity to apply for this loan. With the help of this institution, and by purchasing the organic fertilizer, he will be able to grow potatoes and other products. This will give him food security and help him generate earnings in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica es el comercio, tiene un negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza, hace más de 3 años que viene desempeñándose en este rubro en el cual ya tiene bastante experiencia, fue idea de su esposo de emprender un negocio, buscando obtener ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que con el sueldo que el percibía no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así  que tuvo que ver otras maneras de conseguir ingresos, y fue así como empezó con el negocio, gracias al apoyo de su familia que pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un stock de productos en su vitrina. Con la ganancia de las ventas de sus productos espera implementar su negocio y mas adelante ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero solicitado de S/.2000.00 lo invertirá en la compra cosméticos tales como perfumes , delineadores, rubores , entre otros y vitrinas para surtir  más su negocio.
texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old, married, and has two children who lives at home with her. Her main economic activity is business. She has a business dedicated to the sale of beauty products. She has been working in this business for 3 years and has a lot of experience. 

It was her husband's idea for her to open a business. They were looking to earn more income to improve their family's quality of life because her husband's income didn't cover the household expenses. This is why they had to seek other ways to earn income, and this is how she began her business.

Thanks to the support of her family, she could move forward and now she has products stocked in her display case. With the earnings from her sales, she hopes to implement her business and, in the future, expand her business to increase her sales and earn more income.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the support that she receives to move forward. Additionally, she promises to make her payments on time.

She will invest the 2,000 soles that she has requested in the purchase of cosmetics like perfume, eyeliner, blush, and other things, and display cases to furnish her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like perfume, eyeliner, blush, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 20 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de sus padres acompañada únicamente de ellos. Su principal actividad económica se centra en el comercio, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo, hace  casi 2 años que se dedica a este negocio junto a su mamá, buscando la  manera de generar sus propios ingresos. Al principio tuvieron muchas dificultades por que sus ventas eran muy bajas y no rendía mucho, pero con el tiempo empezaron a surtir la tienda y comenzó a dinamizarse las ventas, gracias a Dios y la unión de su familia es que salio adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable que le genera utilidades. Como una mujer emprendedora Martha, espera sacar adelante a su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de calidad. Para Martha Lucero este es su primer crédito de Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido  y promete puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas.
El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Martha is 20 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman. She lives only with her parents. She is a businesswoman. She sells groceries from her house. For the past two years she has been in this business, along with her mother. They are searching for a way to earn income. At first they had a lot of difficulty because they had few sales and they didn't earn much. But with time they began to provide a greater variety of goods and they began to increase their sales. Thanks to God and their united family, they are moving forward and now they have a stable business that generates income. As an enterprising woman, Martha hopes to increase her small business and make it grow in a way that will increase the goods that she provides for her customer. She wants to offer them better quality products. This is Martha's first loan from KIVA and she is very appreciative of the economic support she receives. She promises to pay her payments on time. The money she is requesting, 1500.00 soles, she will use to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar and milk among others.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar and milk among others.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 70 años de edad, es casado y padre de tres hijos, pero ya no viven con él. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un adolescente, ayudando a su padre en el cultivo de maíz y en la actualidad siempre se dedica a las mismas actividades.

Para comprar los productos tiene que salir a pie y caminar unos 30 minutos y luego de haber realizado las compras espera que pase algún vecino con vehículo para que le transporte los fertilizantes hasta su casa.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar 3 sacos de abono y si le alcanza comprara pesticidas para la maleza. De esta manera, comprara los productos a tiempo y en un solo viaje, no tiene que reunir el dinero para comprar una parte y luego reunir más para comprar el resto y le hará una mejor aplicación de los productos a sus cultivos y obtendrá una mejor cosecha y ganancias para darles un mejor sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 70 years old, married, and is the father of 3 children, but they no longer live with him. He has worked in agriculture since he was a teenager, helping his father to grow corn. Now, he works in the same business.

To buy his products, he has to leave on food and walk 30 minutes. After making his purchases, he has to wait until a neighbor passes in a vehicle to transport the fertilizer to his house.

He will use the loan to buy 3 bags of manure and, if he has enough money left, he will buy pesticides to control weeds. He will buy his products one time and in one single trip so he won't have to collect the money to buy a small part and then later gather the money to buy the rest. He will be able to apply the products to his crops more effectively, and he will obtain a better harvest and income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of manure and, if there is enough money left, to buy pesticides to control weeds.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: El señor Victoriano, es una persona de 62 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y no cuenta con dependientes económicos, actualmente el señor Victoriano vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico con techo de teja y muros de adobe en el cual cuenta con servicio de luz y también agua potable del servicio de agua potable no pagan nada, su actividad económica principal es la producción agrícola en tal sentido produce los siguientes productos agrícolas; papa 400 cargas, oca 10 cargas, avena (forraje) 89 carmas, haba (verde) 15 cargas, y finalmente chicha en tal entendido el señor Victoriano se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para compra de insumos agrícolas, y de tal forma poder incrementar su producción agrícola y por ende también mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoriano is a 62-year-old man and is married. He completed primary school and he does not have dependents. Currently, Victoriano lives in his own rustic house with a tile roof and adobe walls. The home has electricity and potable water, for which they do not pay anything.

His principal economic activity is agriculture. He produces the following agricultural products: 400 cargas of potatoes, 10 cargas of oca (a root vegetable), 89 cargas of oatmeal (used for animal feed), 15 cargas of fava beans, and chicha (a fermented corn drink).

Victoriano has found the need to seek working capital to purchase agricultural supplies so that he can increase the production of his crops and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, etc. for growing coffee.

loans.name: Guillermo Gustavo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su esposa e hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a su familia, Guillermo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar fútbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Carnero para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Guillermo trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el realiza labores de campo como sembrado, riego, cosecha y otros, Guillermo trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Guillermo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente el y su familia utilizan una cocina a kerosene la cual presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, de esta manera Guillermo y su familia podrán preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda comercial donde pueda trabajar con ayuda de su esposa.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 39 year old man who lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district with his wife and children whom he loves and are his main reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person who puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, and the need for him to work at a young age to support his family, Guillermo was not able to go to school for a professional career in agriculture like he has wished.  In his free time, he enjoys playing soccer with his friends, and on some occasions, he cooks a delicious lamb stew to share with his family.  

On his own initiative, and with a lot of dedication and determination, Guillermo works as a field laborer on an farm in his city.  As a field laborer, he performs work such as planting, watering, harvesting, etc...  Guillermo works every day starting very early in the morning and works about 10 hours.  He feels at ease doing his work, and believes that he is doing well because of his good performance and his kind treatment of others.  

Guillermo is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to purchase a stove since at the moment, he and his family use a kerosene stove which has some defects and is dangerous.  With this, Guillermo and his family will be able to prepare adequate meals, and in so doing, he will be able to continue to work hard to reach his dream of having his own commercial store where he can work with the help of his wife.

loans.use: purchase a stove.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She resides in Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Luzminda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for more than three years.

She requested a loan of 9,800.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC, which she joined in 2011, to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In the future, Luzminda wants to build a house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 44 years old, married and a humble farmer residing with her family in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent and enrolled in school. She and her spouse help each other to maintain their rice production each harvest season and ensure enough food to provide for their children. They have been involved in the business for almost 15 years.

Since her major source of income is this yearly harvest, she does not want to lose her crops. Because of this, she is requesting a loan to hire laborers to prepare the land and to buy fertilizers to apply on her rice crops. She promises to pay back the loan in full, so she will be able to have the next opportunity to take out larger loans which will allow her to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prepare the land and to buy fertilizers to apply on her rice crops.

loans.name: Kristyl

texts.en:
Kristyl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock for her store, such as spices, soap, canned goods, milk, and sugar.  

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to expand her general store and food vending business.  Kristyl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, bread, shampoo, etc. for her general store business. Aileen has been in this business for 9 years. Aileen earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, bread, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan that she used to buy a greater quantity and variety of groceries, toiletries and beverages for her general store. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items available at the store, the better it will be for her business and for her sales. The profits she earns will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and she looks forward to this higher income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Araceli dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes her grandchildren will have a good education. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en: Faavale is a 35-year-old single woman without children.  She runs a small business selling chicken chips in her community and has been doing this for many years.  Faavale has requested a loan to buy a deep fryer, tongs, fries, dripping oil, box of chicken, salt, foam plates, and seasoning powder.  She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital.  With her earnings, Faavale will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer, tongs, fries, dripping oil, box of chicken, salt, foam plates, and  seasoning powder.

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en:
This is Jacel.  She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.  Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jacel hopes to expand her business and have more income.  She dreams that her family will always be in a good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 12,500 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.  Emely has been in this business for 6 years and has been earning additional income from a general store.

Emely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 48 years old and married with one child who is in school. Edith works very hard to provide for them.

Edith runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Edith has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Edith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosita works hard to support her family.  She has a charcoal business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and from raising ducks and chickens.  Rosita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell for her charcoal business. Rosalinda has been in this business for 5 years. Rosalinda earns additional income from raising ducks and chickens and buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito is 47 years old, married and blessed with three children. His family live harmoniously in the village of Carmencita on the island of Isabela, in the Philippines. Warlito makes a living farming rice and corn. Due to insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase  fertilizers, urea, seeds and other supplies. He will make these purchases every two months in his home town. Warlito says that he faces challenges such as pests and diseases that damage his crops. He is hoping to have a financially stable life and to buy another plot of land so that he can expand his business to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, urea, seeds and other farming supplies

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 32 years old and married with one child. She lives in Polacion, Bonifacio, in the Philippines. Faith owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for more than three years, earning 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan of 9,600 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy fertilizer such as manure. 

Faith joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and better her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años respectivamente con quien vive en su casa propia.
Maria se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de dos hectareas, actualmente esta sembrando maiz y está ya se encuentra en la epoca de cosecha, lleva 10 años en está actividad y espera aumentar sus parcelas agrícolas con el único fin de obtener mayores ingresos económicos y brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero solicitado de S/.1000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico para sus 2 hectáreas de maíz y así aumentar sus parcelas de producción.
texts.en:
