Maria is 40 years old. She is married and has a ten-year-old son with whom she lives in her own home.

Maria works in agriculture on her two-hectare plot of land. She is currently planting corn and it is already the harvesting season. She has been doing this work for ten years, and she hopes to increase her agricultural plots in order to make better earnings and provide the best for her son.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead. She is committed to making her loan payments in a punctual manner. She will invest the 1,000 soles in buying organic fertilizer for her two hectares of cornfields, and increase her production in this way.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her cornfields.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil Soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Terrenal perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla TERRENAL se encuentra ubicada el  recinto TERRENAL, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz este empezando a trabajar en un pedazo de terreno que le dio el padre para que siembre. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo. 

El sueño es comprar maquinaria para la agricultura para que se haga menos el trabajo, en los tiempos libres le gusta salir con los amigos a jugar futbool.
texts.en: Carlos is 20 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the precinct of Terrenal in the village of Pueblo Viejo in Los Ríos province. He belongs to the Terrenal community bank located in the precinct, and he makes a living in farming and livestock. He grows corn and is starting to work on a plot of land his father gave him. With the loan he plans to purchase supplies like fertilizers, manure and insecticides to eliminate plagues and diseases from his crops. He will make the purchases in Pueblo Viejo. His dream is to purchase some farming machinery so he can do less work. In his free time he likes to go out with his friends to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure and insecticides for his crops.

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en:
Jermelyn is 48 years old, married and has three children who are not in school. 

Jermelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jermelyn requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jermelyn has been pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jermelyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zulma Milagros

texts.es:
Zulma es una mujer de 32 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a su familia, Zulma no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Obstetricia que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Zulma trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa,  ella vende prendas de vestir de diversas temporadas para damas, caballeros y niños, Zulma trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Zulma se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir de la temporada de invierno, de esta manera Zulma tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Zulma is 32 years old, single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who focuses all of her efforts on making headway. Sadly, due to a lack of economic resources and out of the need to work from a very young age to support her family, Zulma was not able to study for a professional obstetrics degree like she would have liked. In her free time she enjoys cooking a delicious Tallarines Rojos (noodles in tomato sauce) to share with her family. On her own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Zulma works at her small business selling clothes. She sells diverse clothes for various seasons for men, women and children. She works approximately 10 hours every day and thinks it is going well thanks to her good prices and the way she treats her customers. Zulma is very grateful for Kiva lenders, because thanks to your support she will be able to purchase a larger quantity and wider variety of clothes for the winter season and in this way she will have a well-stocked business and attract more customers. This will help her continue working hard to achieve her biggest dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Fiaputa

texts.en:
Fiaputa is a 35-year-old married woman with nine children. 
She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Fiaputa has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, spade and a rake. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Fiaputa will spend her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, spade and a rake

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh is a housewife with two children who lives in the village, In order to help her husband, she works as a farmer. Ni Luh is turning again to MUK to borrow 1.5 million IDR for her capital. As part of Sari Mertha group, Ni Luh plans to use this loan to buy three fattening piglets, each costing 400.000 IDR to be raised for six months.
Ni Luh expects the price per kilo of pig to be going up and feed prices going down in the next six months so that the benefits will exceed the previous period.
The profits will be used to finance her children's school fees and to raise capital for her pig business.
One of the members resigned because she already had enough savings as capital to run the business by herself.

loans.use: To buy three fattening piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Jay - Ar

texts.en: Jay-Ar is 37 years old, married and is from Carmencita. He owns a small plot of land where he has been growing rice since 2003. Farming has been his family's main source of income so he has been doing his best to increase his yield. He is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 as additional farming capital to buy fertilizer and seedlings. This loan will be very helpful for him to improve his crop. Eventually, this will help him improve his production when the harvest season comes.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos; pero solo dos viven con ella. Se dedica a los oficios del hogar, cuido de aves de patio y cuido de una vaca, esto lo hace desde siempre y es algo que lo aprendió porque son las actividades que se hacen día a día en las comunidades rurales.

Los alimentos y medicamentos para sus aves y su vaca, los compra en una ciudad que se encuentra a unos 45 minutos de su casa y tiene que caminar a pie para ir a realizar sus compras.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar unos cerdos y para hacer algunas mejoras en su casa. De esta forma, incrementara la crianza de cerdos; ella podrá tener mejores ingresos, ya que tendrá disponible para ofrecer más y con las mejoras en la vivienda podrán vivir con mejores comodidades.

Sus aspiraciones a futuro son aumentar su hato ganadero.
texts.en:
Juana is 57 years old, is married and is the mother of three children, but only two live with her. She is engaged in household activities, taking care of barnyard fowl, taking care of a cow. She has always done this, and learned how to do it because these are activities that are done day to day in rural communities.

She buys medicine for her birds and cow in a city found 45 minutes from her house. She has to walk on foot to go to shop.

She will use the loan to buy several pigs and to make some improvements in her home. Thus, she will increase the growth of pigs and will be able to have a better income because she will have it available to provide more. With the improvements in her house, she will be able to live with better amenities.

Her future aspirations are to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and to make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a busniess farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seed for her business.

Fe has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, es padre de cinco hijos; pero solo viven con él tres nietos. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz y café, toda la vida se ha dedicado a esas actividades y aprendió el trabajo porque sus padres se dedicaban a ello y todos los vecinos trabajan en cafetales y siembra de maíz.

Los productos los compra en una ciudad que se encuentra a unos 30 minutos de su casa, y camina a pie unos 10 minutos para abordar uno de los pick up que transportan pasajeros.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar 5 sacos de abono para aplicárselo a la plantación de café y obtener una mejor cosecha de café.

Al aplicar los fertilizantes está asegurando que su cosecha sea mejor y su finca le rinda más y obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y para seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Su objetivo, es cultivar los terrenos baldíos, sembrarles café y mejorar e incrementar sus fincas
texts.en:
Lucas is 63 years old and married. He has five children, but only three grandchildren live with him. He grows corn and coffee and he has been in this line of work all his life. He learned the business because his parents used to work on that and all the neighbors work in coffee plantations and sow corn.

He buys the supplies in a town located about 30 minutes from his home, and he walks for about 10 minutes in order to get on one of the pick-up trucks that carry passengers.

He'll use the loan to purchase five sacks of compost so that he can use them in his coffee crop and obtain a better coffee harvest.

By using the fertilizers he'll ensure that his harvest will improve and that his farm will yield more profits. Also, he'll obtain higher earnings for his family and for continuously investing in the farm.

His goal is to sow the waste lands, grow coffee on them and improve his farms.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of compost so he can use them in his coffee crop and obtain a better harvest.

loans.name: Rigner

texts.en:
Rigner is 30 years of age, married, and has been blessed with five children. He has owned and operated an auto repair shop in their village for almost six years. In this business he's earning a net income of PHP 1,200 a day.

Due to a lack of capital, he's requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000. He will use this amount to purchase parts and materials needed in his auto repair shop. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted, so that he will be able to improve and expand his business more.

loans.use: To purchase parts and materials needed in his auto repair shop

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 35-year-old married woman living with her family composed of her husband and one kid. Farming is the family's main source of income, so she is doing her best in it to uplift her family's living. She has two years of experience in farming, and she found the business to be good. She now owns a plot of land that she cultivates and plants rice on to be sold to traders. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) as additional farming capital. Using it, Marilyn will buy seeds to grow and fertilizers for the crop maintenance. Moreover, she will use the excess amount in buying gasoline for her crop's water supply, which is from a machine-operated deep well. She hopes that the amount requested will be approved, for it is very helpful in meeting her farming needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow and fertilizers for the crop maintenance.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Miraflor is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Miraflor has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. Elizabeth earns more income from pig fattening.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gerlyn works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines.

Gerlyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional vegetables to sell at her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, so she can further build her vegetable-selling business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Rosita is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 36 years old and married with three children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Leonora has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for 14 years and also earns an income from farming and selling vegetables.

Leonora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa (woven palm mats) to sell.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Arlyn has been in this business for seven years. Arlyn earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer luchadora de 36 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración de petates (Artesanías), y a los oficios del hogar, a las artesanías se dedica desde que era jovencita; le enseño el oficio su abuelita y siempre se ha dedicado a esas actividades.

Los materiales los compra a los productores del lugar, quienes llegan donde ella a ofrecerle los rollos de tule (material que se utiliza para elaborar los petates).


El crédito lo utilizara para comprar siete rollos de tule, para tejer petates. Con la inversión, comprara más material para tener disponible y tejer durante todo el año, asegurando un ingreso constante todo el tiempo. Uno de sus sueños es construir una vivienda digna para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. She works making handcrafted sleeping mats and looking after her household. She has been making handicrafts since she was very young. Her grandmother taught her the trade and she has always worked doing this activity.

She buys materials from local producers, who come to her with rolls of tule, the material she uses to make the mats.

She will use this loan to buy seven rolls of tule, to weave sleeping mats. With this investment, she will buy more material in order to have it available to weave throughout the whole year. This will ensure that she has a steady income all the time. One of her dreams is to build a decent home for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy seven rolls of tule, to weave sleeping mats.

loans.name: Moussouliyatou

texts.fr: Moussiliyatou est une femme âgé(e) de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 01 âgé de 08ans qui va à l’école. Moussiliyatou travaille comme revendeuse de plastiques depuis 2008. Elle exerce l’activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché. Moussiliyatou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des objets plastiques(bassines, gobelet et autres. Elle veut diversifier la marchandise en vendant d’autres produits et mieux s’occuper de l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Moussiliyatou is a 33-year-old woman married to a merchant. She has one child who is eight years old and goes to school.

Moussiliyatou has been selling plastic goods since 2008. She conducts her business in a shop and procures her goods in Lome. Her challenge is competition in the marketplace.

Moussiliyatou has asked for her third loan through WAGES in order to buy plastic goods (basins, cups, and other goods). 

She wants to diversify her merchandise by selling other products. Also, she wants to better provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods for resale

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 36-year-old resident of Poblacion, Bonifacio Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She provides for her three children's needs from the small income of 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) she earns monthly from her corn farming business. She has helped her husband raise corn for more than six years.

Her previous loan helped the couple to generate a larger harvest and now, she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer such as manure. Wilma wants to expand her farm for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.fr: Couturier de profession, Philippe âgé de 34ans est père de famille. Sa femme est revendeuse. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un atelier en 2004 dans lequel il coud les habits. En plus de la couture, il vend des produits de mercerie. C’est dans le but d’augmenter son stock de mercerie qu’il sollicite ce troisième crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il voudrait assurer les besoins primaires de la famille et agrandir l’activité.
texts.en:
A tailor by profession, Philippe is 34 years old and a father of a family. His wife is a retailer.

After his training, Philippe opened a workshop in 2004 where he sews clothing. In addition to this, he also sells sewing supplies.

With the goal of increasing his stock of sewing supplies, Philippe is seeking his third loan through WAGES. 

In the future, he would like to ensure the basic needs of his family and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Gloria Ivania

texts.es:
Doña Gloria es originaria de la ciudad de León, tiene 51 años de edad , madre de  dos hijos una de 24 años la otra de 11 años. Ella es soltera desde hace cinco años se separó de su esposo. Se dedica a vender ropa pero al mismo tiempo es profesora de español empezó con su negocio hace 2 años, vendiendo entre sus compañeros de trabajo ropa interior cada vez le pedían mas fue así que ella decidió meterse de lleno en el negocio de ropa.
Solicita el prestamo para comprar ropa variada como: camisas, pantalón, falda y ropa interior. Su meta futuro es hacer mejoras  a su casa y  tener su propia tienda de ropa ya que ese negocio es rentable, de esta manera brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is from the city of León, she is 51 years old and the mother of two daughters aged 24 and 11. She is single since five years back, when she separated from her husband. She works selling clothes, but she is also a Spanish teacher. She started her business two years ago, selling underwear to her colleagues. She started getting more and more orders, which is why she decided to start working full-time in the clothes selling business.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy clothes such as shirts, trousers, skirts, and underwear. Her goals for the future are to make improvements to her house and to have her own clothing store, since this business has proven to be profitable, thus offering her daughters a better future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, skirts, and underwear

loans.name: Dorette

texts.fr: Dorette est une femme de 35 ans, marié et mère de 3 enfants. Elle possède et gère une boutique depuis 6 mois où elle vend des produits alimentaires. Dynamique, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforces son stock de marchandises en acheter des boissons gazeuses et les produits de première nécessité afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital d'une part et subvenir au besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Dorette is a dynamic 35-year-old, married, and a mother of three children. She owns and has been running a shop for six months where she sells food products.  

Dorette is asking for a loan to increase her stock of merchandise. To increase her sales, [she will] buy carbonated drinks and basic goods in order to satisfy her growing customer base. 

Earnings made are going to be put back into the business and also used to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin's family lives in the village of Carmencita where farming is the primary source of income for most families. He is very energetic in doing his daily farming chores. His farm size now is sort of small, so he is working hard to be able to expand it in the future for his family. 

He is requesting the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy sacks of fertilizers and seeds for his farming business. Benjamin will be greatly touched and happy if lenders will support him financially. He promises to be more responsible in his business endeavors, and punctual in his loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 51 años de edad, es una mujer casada y vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Betty se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general tales como cremas corporales, faciales , perfumes , entre otros, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo. Se inició en este negocio buscando mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro Como una mujer emprendedora Betty espera salir adelante y hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor producto y de calidad.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para implementar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos para implementar su negocio tales como cremas, perfumes, labiales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Betty is 51 years old, married, and lives with her children in the house she owns. She sells different cosmetics such as body lotions, facial creams, perfumes, etc. She conducts her business at home. She started this business in order to improve her income and offer her children a better future. Betty is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to progress and make her little business grow so that she can offer her clients quality products. 

This is Betty's first loan with Kiva, she is very grateful for getting the opportunity to take a loan that will be of great help to her business. This time she is applying for 2000 PEN that she will use to buy cosmetics for her business such as lotions, perfumes, lip balms, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as lotions, perfumes, lip balms, etc

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle has always sought to start ventures that help people and support the community.  Being no stranger to marketing and fundraising, she started The ABC’s of Financing, a service that creates an intuitive process for individuals or companies to achieve either a nonprofit status or assist businesses seeking to generate additional revenue. The ABC’s of Financing offers comprehensive consultation packages including social media marketing, fundraising campaigns as well as the creation of sponsor and vendor proposals. 

Half of Michelle’s clients are individuals who currently hold non-profit status; the remainders are businesses who are seeking to generate additional revenue through networking with the community. Michelle currently employs three consultants who assist her clients with website development, marketing and fundraising, but she feels that there is a strong demand that may increase her staff in the future. 

What is most rewarding for Michelle is seeing the businesses of those she counsels thrive. She shares, “I get to use my intelligence and creativity to help people achieve their dreams and help make this world and our community a better place to live.” 

Michelle is confident in her business model but has had difficulty with traditional routes of funding her growth. She shares, “as I have worked in primarily cash only businesses it has been difficult to establish credit for a loan to expand.” She plans to use her $5,000 Kiva loan to pay for video and camera equipment to provide her clients with professional quality media on their social media outlets and crowd funding platforms.

What drives Michelle is her passion about transitioning her clients into the nonprofit ecosystem while helping them avoid the difficult hurdles that plague so many startups. Her advice, “Mistakes are what we call our experiences; discoveries are what we call our achievements. Ask yourself, do you want to discover a world you can achieve in or live in a world experiencing only mistakes?”

loans.use: to pay for video and camera equipment to provide her clients with professional quality media

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 43 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shirly is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 41 years old and married with four children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. 

Her previous loan helped her augment their living situation.

Rachel joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephinenis35 years old. She and her family are currently residing in the village of San Vicente, where the main business is farming. With this business, she's asking for a loan of PHP 26,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. For all her efforts, her crops are growing productively. She hopes that her agricultural business will continuously become more progressive so that she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is a 49-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lupe has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, fertilizer, chainsaw and pickaxe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. With her profits, Lupe hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, fertilizer, a chainsaw and a pickaxe

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 54-year-old married mother of three and a resident of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham, in Cambodia. She is a dedicated farmer who works hard to support her family. She names her husband and children as the main people in her life giving her a helping hand to work out their plans. Ut has farmed her own pieces of land for more than 30 years. Through her sacrifice and perseverance, she aims to improve her business and better her living conditions.

She is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which her employed children will use to commute to work. This will reduce their monthly travelling expenses and enable them to get to work on time. A small portion of the loan will also help her to cover the operating costs of farming. Her plan is to keep improving her business and renovate her house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Olga de 35 años de edad, tiene 1 niña que depende de ella,  está separada de su esposo pero el siempre le ayuda, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de pan, recargas, refrescos y huevos desde hace tres años.
Doña Olga sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que la visitan para comprarle su producto y también sale a vender los fiches de semana a la zona sur del país, es una mujer muy luchadora ya que también trabaja en un comedor. 
Doña Olga el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pan como ser bollitos, biscochos, semitas, hojaldras, huevos, etc.  Espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Olga su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y poder ayudar siempre a su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Olga is 35 years old and has one dependent daughter.  She is separated from her husband, but he still helps out.  She lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa in the central region of Honduras.  She has sold bread, beverages, minutes for mobile phones, and eggs for the past 3 years.

Olga's customers are her neighbors and friends that come to her in order to buy her products. She also goes to the southern region of the country each week to sell her items. She is a strong-willed woman that works very hard, and she also works in a small restaurant.

Olga is seeking this loan so that she can buy bread items such as muffins, biscuits, sweet rolls, cookies, eggs, etc.  She hopes that this loan will help her improve her quality of life by offering a greater variety of products to her customers. Olga's dream is that her business grows and that she will always be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy muffins, biscuits, sweet rolls, cookies, eggs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Gilder

texts.es:
Gilder es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Gilder no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Electrónica que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Juane para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gilder se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde cultiva maíz, frejoles y una fruta llamada camu camu, él realiza labores de campo todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 9 horas, Gilder se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Gilder se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastas de abono, riego y cosecha de su cultivo de camu camu, de esta manera Gilder podrá obtener una buena cosecha para poder venderla a un buen precio, así pues Gilder seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar sus cultivos y con el tiempo desea tener una tienda de abarrotes para trabajar con su esposa.
texts.en:
Gilder is 32 years old. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their 2 children who he loves deeply and who are the central focus of his life.  He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person that, along with his wife, dedicates all of their efforts to helping their family get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because of his need to work since he was a very young man, Gilder was unable to study for his dream career in electrical engineering.  In his free time he likes to walk around the area and sometimes he cooks delicious dishes to share with his family.

Due to his own initiative, with a lot of work and dedication, Gilder works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel of land on which he grows corn, beans, and a fruit called camu camu.  He works every day for about 9 hours.  Gilder enjoys his work and believes it is going well because of the friendly way in which he treats others.

Gilder is very thankful for the Kiva loans and sends his thanks for the help that he is receiving so that he can cover the costs of fertilizer, irrigation and harvesting of his camu camu crop.  With this help, Gilder will be able to bring in a bigger harvest and sell it at a good price.  Gilder will continue working and struggling to make his biggest dream come true - to increase his harvest, and in time, to own a general store so that he can work with his wife.

loans.use: to cover the costs of fertilizer, irrigation, and harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Colette Yvette

texts.fr: Colette est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a un atelier de couture depuis 10 ans dans un coin de la ville. perfectionniste, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une machine afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectées dans son capital d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Colette is a 50-year old woman who is married and mother to five children. She has had a sewing workshop in an area of the town for the past ten years. She is a perfectionist and is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine so that she can increase her turnover. The profits she generates will be partly used to boost her capital and partly to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Elvira Ramona

texts.es:
Doña Elvira  es originaria de La ciudad de León, es casada, tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace siete años el cual para ella ha sido un negocio exitoso.  Su actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, vende de casa en casa, a empresas, fábricas en busca de clientes vende al contado y al crédito, también trabajan con catálogos de cosméticos pues entre mayor sea su venta mejores serán las ganancias. 
Hoy está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar perfumes, crema, pintura labial, shampo, etc. Uno de sus proyectos es construir un cuarto que tiene pendiente y más adelante quiere tener su propio punto de venta
texts.en:
Elvira is originally from the city of León, she is married, and she has three children.  She has sold cosmetics for the past 7 years and it has been a successful business for her.  She sells her products by foot, going from house to house, to businesses, and to factories in search of customers.  She sells her products for cash or credit.  She also works with cosmetic catalogues because the better brands bring her a higher profit.

Today she is seeking a loan so that she can buy perfumes, lotions, lipstick, shampoo, etc.  One of her projects is to complete building a room in her home that she will eventually use as a sales location.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, lipstick, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Migpange, Bonifacio, the Philippines. Tita used her last loan to pay for catching more crabs, and as a result her business has grown and become successful. Recently, she took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to cover the costs of harvesting more crabs and shrimp to sell. She hopes to generate more income in order to save a portion of it to improve the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of catching crabs and shrimp

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañado. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; fue su abuelo quien le enseño a trabajar este rubro; debido a que su padre emigro a otro país para buscar una mejor vida. Él junto a su abuelo se dedicaban a trabajar muy duro cultivando la tierra para llevar los granos básicos a su casa. Cuando el creció también emigro; pero este sueño fue frustrado ya que en una redada lo repatriaron al país, esto fue ase 7 años y al venir acá se acompaño y vive junto a su esposa quien esta embarazada. El trabaja muy duro para darle una buena vida a su esposa y para tener un hogar digno a donde pueda nacer y crecer su bebe el cual viene en camino.

Él tiene que trasladarse a la ciudad mas cercana a comprar los insumos que no puede producir para su hogar. Tiene que trasladarse a 2 kilómetros desde su casa a la ciudad y como no hay trasporte tiene que cargar todos los productos en su espalda y esto le genera un gran desgaste físico y cuando por el trabajo no puede ir;  la esposa se encarga de las compras lo cual le genera el mismo problema y en su estado puede ser riesgoso ese tipo de esfuerzo ya que la calle no esta en buen estado.

Él solicita el crédito para comprar bloque, cemento, arena, grava, ya que la teja ya la tiene y el hierro ya lo tiene comprado con anticipación, para la reparación de su vivienda donde hará unas paredes para la cocina de su casa ya que no quiere tenerla dentro de la casa.

La principal necesidad será que podrá comprar todos lo materiales de una sola vez y así podrá percibir un ahorro en las compras también el viaje que cancelara al carro que le lleve los materiales será mas bajo ya que solo tendrán que realizar uno. Su vida mejorara ya que tendrá un hogar digno donde su hijo pueda crecer sin ningún problema.

En un futuro desea contar con una mejor vivienda, darles una excelente vida a su familia y seguir trabajando muy duro para no pasar tantas preocupaciones y siendo una familia muy unida así como darle una buena educación a su hijo y el amor de padre que a él le fue negado.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old and he is married.  He has worked in agriculture since he was young.  His grandfather taught him how to do this work.  It should have been his father to teach him, but his father emigrated to another country in search of a better life.  Together with his grandfather, he worked very hard, cultivating the land to grow basic grains.  When he got older he also emigrated, but this dream was interrupted when he was discovered in a raid and sent back home to his country.  This was 7 years ago. He and his wife returned home and his wife is now pregnant. He works very hard to provide a good life for his wife and to make a nice home where they can raise a child, who is coming soon.

He has to travel to the closest city to buy supplies that he can't grow at his home.  He has to travel 2 kilometers (1.25 miles) from his home to the city and since there is no transportation, he has to bring all of his products on his back and this creates many physical ailments.  His wife does the shopping which causes the same physical problems, and in her state of pregnancy she cannot take the risk of this type of physical activity.

He is seeking a loan so that he can buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel, since he has already purchased tiles and iron - for the improvement of his home.  

The current need is to be able to buy the materials one time to take advantage of bulk discounts and also so that he can pay for transport only once to get the supplies back to his home.  His life will improve and he will have a proper home where his child can be raised without problems.

In the future he hopes to have a better life and to give a better life to his family.  He wants to continue working very hard and to stop worrying.  He wants a close-knit family and to provide a good education for his child.  He will love his child the way a father should, which was denied to him in his life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and gravel for improving his home.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is 51 years old and single. She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Agapita is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Agapita has been farming sugar cane for three years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile phone loading. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marina Elena

texts.es:
La señora Marina de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos que depende de ella, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa, en la zona centro de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada desde hace 8 años.
Doña Marina sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y también sus compañeros de trabajo ya que labora en una compañía de limpieza es una mujer muy luchadora que desea salir adelante.
Doña Marina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, calzonetas, etc. Espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Marina su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y poder ayudar siempre a su familia.


Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Marina is 49 years old, lives with her spouse, and has 2 children who depend on her. She lives in a neighbourhood of Tegucigalpa, in the central zone of Honduras. For 8 years she has dedicated herself to selling new and used clothing.

Doña Marina's customers are her neighbours, friends, and also her coworkers, as she works at a cleaning company. She is a very hard-working woman who wants to get ahead in life.

Doña Marina needs this loan to purchase pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, bathing suits, etc. She hopes that this investment will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family by offering more products to her customers. 

Doña Marina's dream is that her business will become bigger and can always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, dresses, skirts, shirts, bathing suits, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lita works hard to support her family. She has a business making nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lita is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional raw materials such as nipa leaves and bamboo for her business.

This is Lita's tenth loan, having successfully paid back all her previous loans and used them to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials such as palm leaves and bamboo for her business

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn is 34 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jinalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jinalyn has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Roger no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios y eso lo imposibilito para no poder estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta remendar redes.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Roger trabaja como pescador artesanal, el tiene un pequeño bote donde realiza sus labores, adicionalmente también se dedica a la construcción de casas maderas, Roger trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su deseo de superación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Roger se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales como mayas, hilo de pescar, pita, sogas y otros, de esta manera Roger podrá seguir remendando sus redes para poder pescar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada construida con materiales resistentes que aseguren el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is a 48 year old man, living in the city of Pucallpa with his spouse and his two children, whom he loves and sees as his main reason for living. He is a friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who together with his spouse devotes all of his efforts to improving life for his family. Regrettably, because of a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a young age to help his parents, Roger could not finish secondary school, which made it impossible for him to pursue a professional degree. In his free time, he likes to mend his nets.

On his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Roger works as a traditional fisherman. He has a small boat where he does his work. As well, he builds wooden houses. Roger works every day from the early hours of the morning, and often continues for about 12 hours. He enjoys his work and feels that it is a good fit for his desire to improve his life and the friendly way he treats others.

Roger is very grateful for Kiva's small loans, as thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase materials such as fishing nets, fishing line, ropes, and more. This way, Roger can continue mending his nets to be able to fish, and continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of having a secure home that is well-constructed with solid materials that ensure the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 57 years old and resides at Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for more than 26 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 doing this type of work. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to purchase canned goods, bottled products sachet and dairy products for sale.  In the future, Rebecca wants to build a house and finish supporting her child's studies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products sachet and dairy products for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam, 42 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a restaurant in their village for almost 10 years; in this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 a day. Due to insufficient capital she's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to purchase food ingredients, raw meat, and additional materials needed in her restaurant such as plastic cups. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, raw meat, and additional materials needed in her restaurant such as plastic cups.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilio is from the village of Alicia. He is 50 years old and is married. He is thankful because his marriage was blessed with one child. Together with his wife, Basilio manages a sari-sari store (variety store) business to raise his family well. They have been in this business for two years now. 

Basilio is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted bread, beverages and more stocks of merchandise to sell. He hopes to grow the business well to keep his family's standard of living progressive.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, condiments, assorted bread, beverages and more stocks of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet  is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 37 years old and married with three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Janet owns and operates a general store or "sari-sari store," selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Jessica earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase paints, bamboo, nails, etc for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase paints, bamboo, nails, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mischeal

texts.en:
Mischeal is a married woman with one child. She is 27 years old and resides in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Her husband is a dry goods vendor and she helps him to gain income for the family.

Mischeal cultivates fruit trees and harvests their fruit for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. 

She has requested a new loan of 8,000.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to cover the cost of weeding, maintenance and replanting. In the future, she wants to expand the business and use the saved extra income for her child's education.

loans.use: to cover the cost for weeding, maintenance and replanting.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and is married to Fernando, a father of three children. Milagros and her family live in the village of Apanay, a simple but peaceful place. 

To earn a living, she manages a general store. She has been in this business for 22 years and usually earns about PHP 300 each day. 

She needs additional capital to further improve her retailing business. To make this possible, she is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sacks of rice, condiments, noodles, beverages, assorted breads and canned goods. She hopes that she will able to obtain her desired loan to keep improving her sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, condiments, noodles, beverage, assorted bread and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy is married and 33 years old. She has a family comprising five members, living together in Moung Ruessei, Battambang province. 

She is a farmer and her business is growing rice and other seasonal crops from which she is able to cover her living costs and provide allowances for her two school-aged children. She has been engaged in this occupation since 2000 with the full support from her spouse.

Right now, she is applying for a loan to build a bathroom along with a latrine inside for her household, since it is very important and can protect their health. This will allow her to improve their quality of life and the environment. 

She is very grateful for the loan program to help poor families improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom along with a latrine inside for her household.

loans.name: Lucy Preciosa

texts.es: Lucy, con 33 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 12 años. Por falta de oportunidades laborales pasó por una situación económica difícil, pues no tenía recursos para llevar el sustento a su hogar, por este motivo y aprovechando la ventaja de la poca oferta del servicio en el sector, decidió comenzar a realizar actividades de estilista como cepillado, corte, manicure y pedicure, trabajando en su casa o a domicilio, dependiendo de los requerimientos de sus clientes y, sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentaban a la hora de comprar los insumos por unidad, pues no tenía capital suficiente para comprar al por mayor. Así comenzó a salir adelante nuevamente y a obtener los ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas en su hogar. Ella es una mujer guerrera, activa y con ganas de progresar, por eso se motivó para solicitar el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de herramientas e insumos de trabajo (plancha para el cabello, shampoo, acondicionador, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas) con el fin de poder continuar realizando su trabajo y ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así podrá aumentar sus ingresos. Lucy sueña con montar su propia sala de belleza, donde le pueda ofrecer mayor comodidad y mejor servicio a sus clientes y que le permita dar oportunidad de empleo a otras personas, así tendrá una estabilidad económica favorable para que su hijo tenga una excelente educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucy, 33 years old, is a single mother of a 12 year old son.  Due to lack of career opportunities, she went through a difficult financial time as she did not have the resources to bring money home.  This motivated her to take advantage of the lack of service offerings in this sector.  She decided to start working as a stylist, brushing hair, cutting hair, and giving manicures and pedicures.  She works out of her house or at her clients' homes, depending on their preferences.  At first, she had to purchase her supplies in small quantities as she did not have the capital to purchase them wholesale.  This allowed her to begin to get ahead and earn the income necessary to satisfy the basic needs of her household.

She is a hardworking and active woman with an eagerness to advance, which motivated her to request this loan.  She wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of supplies and tools for her work (hair straightener, shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish) with the goals of continuing her work and offering her clients better service, and in so doing increase her income. 

Lucy dreams of opening her own beauty salon where she would be able to offer a more comfortable setting and better service to her clients, and also give her the opportunity to employ others.  This will also allow her better financial stability so her son can have an excellent education and better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tools and supplies for work (hair straightener, shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, nail polish).

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

She has been doing embroidery work by machine at home for the past five years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work in a firm, but he earns an insufficient income to support his family alone, so he brings some embroidery work home for her. She helps her husband in his work and also sells knitted embroidery in her town. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase a machine for embroidery. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to use a portion of revenue to provide a high-quality education for her children.

Saira is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 45 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Luz has been farming rice for 24 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 40 years old, married and a father of three. The family is currently residing at the village of Paniki. 

Billy has a duck raising business to earn more income for his family. He aims to improve his business and increase his income to continue sending his children to college. He plans to raise more ducks to lay eggs for sale, but he lack the necessary materials. 

He is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 to buy duck feeds, nets, a tray and a tent needed in raising ducks. He believes that someday he will make more improvements in the business as he continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy duck feeds, nets, a tray and a tent for duck raising.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Dimalco Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and married, with three children. 

Teresita plants, harvests and sells corn for a living. She has been in her business for more than 13 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Teresita joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC. Her previous loans helped her to gain abundant harvests and she used the profits for her children's school needs.

Recently, Teresita has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nuumoa

texts.en: Nuumoa is 56 years old, married, and has five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as bags of sugar, salt, bags of rice, snacks and canned food. She has been doing this for more than three years. Nuumoa needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sugar, sausages, flour, rice, laundry soap, corned beef in cans, canned fish, lollies (candy), snacks, soft drinks, Vailima brand beer, cigarettes and toilet paper for her business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and also to support her family financially. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, sugar, sausages, flour, rice, laundry soap, corned beef in cans, canned fish, lollies (candy), snacks, soft drinks, Vailima brand beer, cigarettes and toilet paper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and jewels to paste on clothing.

loans.name: Sanny Grace

texts.en: Sanny Grace lives in Migpane, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, with her husband. She is 21 years old, and she helps her husband to improve their living situation by buying and selling fish in the market. Her husband is a motorcycle transport driver and, in his free time, he fishes to earn additional income. Sanny Grace took out a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to build their house with the earnings she saves for a better living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Dellie works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store and from raising pigs. Dellie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her bamboo-weaving business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her businesses. Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her bamboo-weaving business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 43 years old, married, and has twelve children, four of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Marilyn has been farming rice for 20 years, and she earns additional income from making nipa (palm thatch). She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: As a widowed parent of five children, Linda works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Linda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Linda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Jemelyn

texts.en: Jemelyn is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. Jemelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell. Jemelyn has borrowed and repaid 19 NWTF loans before this loan. She has been running the dry goods business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from pig fattening and from farming vegetables. Jemelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials, including wood, nails and paint, for her business. Rosario has been in this business for eight years. Rosario earns additional income from a general store. Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, including wood, nails and paint, for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Sartoyo

texts.en:
Sartoyo is a prospective student of Nusantara Maritime Academy who wishes to study marine engineering. Sartoyo lives in a small village, to the west of the town of Cilacap, called Tritih Kulon village. To reach the campus, he  cycles for 1 hour's journey. Although he has to cycle, Sartoyo expects to complete the program of study. 

Sartoyo's parents work as farmers whose income is not fixed. They gather the crops and then sell them and can only meet daily needs, so it is difficult to finance his studies. Sartoyo is willing to work on a ship as a ship technician professional. He also does not want to bother his parents, because his parents are too old to continue work. 

Sartoyo is eager to get a loan from Kiva, to help pay for college expenses, so that he could complete his studies, get a job faster and his parents can be helped in their family economy.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Flamboyan I Group

texts.en:
Flamboyan I group  successfully completed their first cycle with a loan from Kiva and is running smoothly. With that loan in the first cycle, their businesses began to flourish. For this second cycle, there is little change in membership; the number of members is reduced  by 1 and there is also a new member. Currently, the membership is 13 members in the 2nd cycle of Flamboyan i group. 

Besides the same types of business as in the first cycle, selling traditional foods such as egg rolls, 'arem-arem', 'wet pastel' (like empanadas), 'gethuk lindri', branches 'Gesing, nagasari', there is also a business selling clothes. With the loan this time, they will increase the types of food and the types of business of the group members. 

Titi is still the leader of this group, because she can provide encouragement to its members, so that, as in the first cycle, the loan repayment can run smoothly for every member. Titi still has a small business making food such as 'wet pastel', 'dry pastel' and egg rolls. Kiva loans benefit her for this; it is very meaningful to her life with her husband and two children. 

Titi hopes cycle 2 will run smoothly and the group's members' businesses can grow even more. With the loan this time, she will buy the equipment for the production of cakes and pastries.

loans.use: To  buy the equipment for the production of cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child in school, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and raising pigs. Wilma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to re-stock her store with different household items like soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, egg, etc. for her general store business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with different household items like soap, milk, shampoo, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a restaurant in the Philippines for 15 years, earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase more meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, a 40-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. The operator of a a general store in the Philippines for 11 years, she sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap, shampoo, diapers and other groceries. 

Marife has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto es un hombre de 52, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Humberto no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional Contabilidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tallarín Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Humberto se dedica a la carpintería y tapicería de muebles, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Humberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de trabajo, madera, pegamento, clavos y demás materiales, de esta manera Humberto podrá seguir realizando sus labores, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder  brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Humberto, 52, lives in the city of Chiclayo, in Guadalupe district, with his wife and two small children. He loves them and they are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-woring, and enthusiastic person who, together with his wife, puts all his efforts into moving his family forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to work to help his parents from the time he was young, Humberto was not able to study the professional degree in Accounting that he wanted. In his free time, he likes to play with his children and sometimes he cooks a delicious Tallarín Saltado (stir-fried noodles) to share with his family.

On his own iniciative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Humberto works in carpentry and the upholstery of furniture. He works every day, from very early in the morning, and he may work about ten hours. He is very comfortable in his work and he believes that it is going well for him because of his good prices and the friendly way he treats others. Humberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy materials for work, like wood, glue, nails, and other materials. This way, Humberto will be able to continue with his work. He will keep working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of giving his children an education.

loans.use: to buy materials for his carpentry and upholstery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her postgraduate studies.

loans.name: Deidid

texts.es:
Deidid es una mujer de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Deidid no pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de corte y confección que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta estar en compañía de su hijo.
Por iniciativa propia, Deidid tiene su pequeño negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, ella cuenta con una casa regularmente grande, en la cual alquila habitaciones para estudiantes y trabajadores, todos los días desde tempranas horas ella inicia sus labores de limpieza y aseo de su hogar para mantener en buen estado su vivienda, Deidid trabaja diariamente por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su empeño y dedicación.
Deidi se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudios y el pago de la matricula de los estudios profesionales de su hijo, ya que este se encuentra estudiando y ella desea apoyarlo, así pues Deidid seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Deidid is 60 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her son, whom she loves and is her main motivating force in life. She is a very kind, hard working and enthusiastic person, who has made all efforts to sustain her family, having been both a father and mother figure for her son. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work from a young age to help her parents, Deidid was not able to study dressmaking as she wanted to. She likes to spend her free time with her son.

By her own initiative, Deidid started her own business renting rooms to students and workers in her rather big house. To keep the house in good repair, she starts cleaning it early in the morning, working for approximately 8 hours every day. She thinks she has done well due to her effort and dedication.

Deidi is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since with their support she will be able to buy study materials and pay the college tuition fees for her son. He is studying and she wishes to assist him, and so Deidid will working hard to achieve her dream of seeing her son become a good professional.

loans.use: To buy study materials and pay the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and a son. She has been knitting handmade embroidery at her home for 6 years. Four of her daughters also help her to complete her tasks. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw irregularly; he is an irresponsible person and does not care about his children. 

Safia has to prove herself as a responsible and brave mother. In 6 years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Saira is requesting a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colours.

She wants to take care of her household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of threads, fancy cloths, sequins and pearls of various colours for embroidery.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 53 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirly operates a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell. In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen offers old-fashioned customer service to Austin and the surrounding communities with his private black car and limo chauffeur business, driving clients to and from the airport saying, “I’m my own competition.” Tired of the multiple work-related fees as a former employee of a similar business, Glen decided to work for himself. A seasoned entrepreneur, Glen says he’s always had side projects to accompany his full-time job, but it was his love for cars that intrigued him enough to open a chauffeur business. “Professionally Driven by Glen Private Driver Services” has been in operation for two years and created four part-time jobs in the Austin area. Glen says he would like to hire one more part-time and full-time driver in the near future. However, he is currently looking to secure any upcoming work needed for his cars. After going to BIG Austin, a community-wide business assistance organization, Glen was referred to nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. He applied and was approved for $5,450. Glen will hold onto the loan in the event that one of his cars needs servicing. He says that knowing he has back-up funds for his business in case of an emergency, he is less stressed. Visit Glen’s website to learn about the types of cars and services he offers at: www.glendrives.com

loans.use: to cover vehicle maintenance work.

loans.name: Melquiades
