Thanks to the loans they have been able to improve their store a great deal and with each loan they stock their store more, as this is their source of income and it is what allows them to get ahead. 

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods, and other necessity items.  She has been with the communal bank from the outset and she likes it because thanks to the loans they get better every day.

Her dream is to have her own location so she will not have to pay rent, which takes a good portion of her profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, canned goods, and other necessity items

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a detergent retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Nena is borrowing 21,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more detergent stock to sell.

loans.name: Yexi Maribel

texts.es:
Yexi tiene 20 años, es una joven microempresaria que tiene el estado civil de unión libre con su cónyuge Cristian de 19 años y que es un joven chofer profesional y trabaja en una compañía de taxis. Tienen un hijo pequeño y viven juntos en la parroquia Abrahan Calazacón en Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Además la visita de turistas nacionales y extranjeros aporta al fortalecimiento de las actividades de los emprendedores que desde hace algunos años han establecido sus negocios alrededor de toda la ciudad. Esta ciudad que es la tercera más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Yexi desde hace 3 años emprendió con el establecimiento de un salón de belleza, pues durante el curso de su secundaria, se especializó en esta rama artesanal la cual disfruta mucho y además cada vez la perfecciona más con cursos que hace en diferentes casas de belleza. Invierte 12 horas cada día incluidos los fines de semana, descansa cuando la demanda del servicio es baja. Su sueño es poder ampliar su salón de belleza con servicios de spa incluidos y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de muebles adecuados para su negocio, sillas en las que pueda brindar confort a sus clientes y también con los que ella pueda desempeñar cómodamente su trabajo, además sillas para atender a niños y muebles para la sala de espera. Yexi cada día incrementa sus clientes por lo que se proyecta a crecer cada día más para el bienestar de su familia. Fundación Alternativa ha sido la institución que le abrió las puertas para poder dar ese cambio que necesita su negocio.
texts.en:
Yexi is 20. She is a young businessperson and is in a common-law marriage with Cristian, 19, who is a young professional driver and works for a taxi company. They have a small child and live together in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the capital city of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Commerce is quite strong in the area, since it is a land port of exchange between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador. Visits from local and international tourists strengthen the local businesses, which have recently grown up all around the city. This is the third-most inhabited city in the region. The residents also work in areas such as agriculture, livestock, fishing, and manufacturing.
Yexi opened a beauty salon three years ago. She specialized in this art in high school, and enjoys it greatly. She is constantly honing her skills through courses at various beauty centres. She works twelve hours a day, every day, including weekends. She rests when there is lower demand for her services. Her dream is to be able to expand her beauty salon with spa services in order to be able to provide work for other people. 
Yexi is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase adequate furniture for her business. She will buy chairs, both to provide her clients with comfort and to allow her to work comfortably. She will also buy chairs for children and furniture for the waiting room. Her clientele grows every day; she expands her business every day for the sake of her family's well-being. Fundación Alternativa opened its doors to her so that she could make this needed change to her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon furniture.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 34 years old and married with an only child. Her husband worked as a jeepney driver providing transportation in the community. She helps him operate their own rice production business.  

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is single, 41 years old and a mother of two in Mwingi. Agnes has been running a grocery store for the past fifteen years with a monthly income of about KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Agnes is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. Agnes intends to use the loan to purchase 2 bags of potatoes costing KES 8,000, 2 bags of onions costing KES 13,000, 2 bags of avocados at KES 4,000, and 1 crate of tomatoes at KES 5,000. She will use the additional income to repay her loan and improve the standard of living of her family. 

Agnes hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of potatoes, 2 bags of onions, 2 bags of avocados, and 1 crate of tomatoes.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old and widowed with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, noodles, etc.

She has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Marilou aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira is 40 years old and married with three children.

Maira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Maira has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Maira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Omar, quien con su credikiva pudo invertir en la compra de productos de aseo personal (desodorantes, talcos, otros), y productos capilares (champú, tintes, acondicionadores, cremas de peinar, otros). Con esta inversión pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo al poder surtir el negocio con más productos, fortaleciendo algunas líneas especificas, trayendo un mayor volumen de ventas, haciendo crecer su negocio. Con este progreso a podido seguir apoyando a sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en productos para la belleza, aseo personal y productos capilares. Omar dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias al programa de Kiva se ha podido consolidar mi negocio”
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Omar, who, with his Kiva loan, was able to invest in the purchase of personal products (deodorants, talcs, etc.) and hair products (shampoo, tints, conditioners, dyes, etc.) With this investment, he was able to increase his working capital to be able to stock his business with more products, expanding certain lines, bringing in more sales, and growing his business. With this progress, he has been able to continue supporting his children. Currently, he is requesting a new loan to invest in beauty products, personal products, and hair products. Omar tells his lenders: "Thanks to Kiva, I have been able to strengthen my business."

loans.use: invest in beauty products, personal hygiene products, and hair products.

loans.name: Cristobal Rafael

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive el señor Cristóbal, tiene 46 años de edad, está soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres. El está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos él y muchos en el grupo salen adelante.

Don Cristobal desde hace muchos años atrás empezó a trabajar en un taller de metalmecánica, allí aprendió todo lo que es arreglo de carrocerías y pintura de vehículos de toda clase, profesión que luego le sirvió para poner su propio taller que es en lo que se desempeña actualmente, el realizar los trabajos a domicilio si así lo quieren sus clientes o en su taller, para él lo importante es trabajar y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, ya que esta es la base para que sus clientes lo recomienden o regresen por el buen servicio que presta, lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual le sirve para salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus padres.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar soldaduras, pinturas y planchas de metal para su trabajo. 

Su sueño es tener un taller con más tecnología.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round. It is also known for being a city of unequalled beauty with many tourist attractions.
Cristóbal lives in this area. He is 46, single, and lives in his parents' home. He has been part of the Communal Bank from the beginning, and he likes it because, thanks to the loans, he and many other members are getting ahead.
Several years ago, Cristobal started working at a mechanic shop. There he learned all about repairing bodywork and paint for all kinds of vehicles. This knowledge served him in later opening his own workshop, where he currently works. He does the work at his clients' homes if they request it, or in his workshop. For him, the important thing is to work and provide good customer service. This will mean that his clients will recommend his business or return because of his good service. He has had this business for over thirty years, and it allows him to get ahead and support his parents.
He will use this loan to buy welding items, paint, and metal planks for his work.
His dream is to have more technology in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy welding items, paint, and metal planks.

loans.name: Nicomedes

texts.es: Don Nicomedes tiene 69 años de edad, es soltero, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura. Hace 6 años decidió por establecer su propio negocio donde vende  ropa de niño, caballeros y damas, calzado, lociones, cosméticos, accesorios etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y le ha invertido varios préstamos, lleva cuatro ciclos con el actual que es por L.20,000, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. El espera tener más surtido su negocio para ofrecer variedad de productos y poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Nicomedes is 69 years old, single, has three children, and lives in a small village in the Arizona municipality, in Atlantida. Before, he was a farmer. Six years ago, he decided to start his own business, selling clothes for children, men, and women, as well as shoes, lotions, cosmetics, accessories, etc. He has his store in his home and has invested several loans in it. He has been through four loan cycles. With the current one, which is for L. 20,000, he will invest in the purchase of clothes for women, men, and children. He hopes to have more inventory to offer a variety of products and be able to move forward.

loans.use: purchase clothes for women, men, and children, to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking mother who helps her husband in generating income for the welfare of her family. She is 49 years old and has three children. She manages their motorcycle transport business while her husband cultivates their farm to get a yield twice a year. 

For the maintenance of their motorcycle, she is asking for a loan of PHP5,000 to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings, gasoline and other accessories needed for their motor vehicle maintenance. She is hoping that her loan will be granted in order for her to continuously use their motorcycle transport business to generate a daily income. She believes that someday, with patience and hard work, their standard of living will be improved.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings, gasoline and other accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a widowed mother with two children. She is 41 years old and lives in in Mwingi, Kenya. She has been running a grocery shop for the past nineteen years with a monthly income of about KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. 

Regina is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk for her grocery store. She will plow back the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk.

loans.name: Ninoska De Jesus

texts.es: La joven Ninoska tiene 31 años de edad, es casada madre de un hijo, ella estudia la carrera de Administración de Empresas, no trabaja su esposo le ayuda a pagar los gastos de universidad. Ninoska solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder comprar una computadora, ya que tiene mucha necesidad de adquirir el equipo para poder hacer los trabajos de proyectos que le dan en la universidad, lo que le permitirá desarrollarse más en su profesión, y una vez culminada su carrera buscar empleo para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Young Ninoska is 31 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She studies business administration. She does not work. Her husband helps her pay for college expenses. Ninoska is requesting a loan to be able to purchase a computer because really needs one to work on the projects she is given at the university, which will help her develop and grow more in her career. Once she graduates, she will look for work to support her family.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 28 years old and married. To make a living, she manages a fish vending business, while her husband does the fishing. She has been in her business for more than three years and earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ruthchel joined GDMPC. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP recently, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, like fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, like fishing nets.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Emperatriz, tiene 48  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad que aun viven en su casa. El marido es maestro constructor. 

Doña Emperatriz es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta en los ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días dependiendo de cómo deseen sus clientes. Lleva más de 10  años dedicada  a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year-round, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Emperatriz lives.  She is 48 years old and she is in a civil union which has produced four grown children who live at home.  Her partner is a master builder.

Emperatriz is a homemaker who sells clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies' accessories) to make her own income and to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells door-to-door in her free time and she leaves her products on credit, collecting every eight or fifteen days depending on her customers' preferences.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams, and cosmetics.  This is her fourth cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick and they help her a lot. 

Her dream is to continue with this.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to create more classes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 47 years old and from the small village of Martvili district. He lives with his brother and mother. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Elguja is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two milking cows and a buffalo. Besides that, he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where 200 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. 

As the existing income is not enough for the family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Elguja applied for credit at MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. With a loan of 4500 GEL (Georgia lari), Elguja will build a greenhouse. As soon as the greenhouse is built, he will grow mushrooms for selling. 

This credit will be a great support for the family. Elguja is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a 29-year-old single mother of one from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. She also offers money transfer services on the side to supplement her income. 

Christine is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn, she will invest in a future salon business. She plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a large wholesale store and to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline lives in Alta Tiera, Tiguma, Pagadian with her family. She is 48 years old with two children. To make a living, she owns and manages a store selling a variety of home use products in the community. She has been doing this for many years in order to uplift their living situation. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she had joined recently, to buy canned goods, sugar and noodles for resale. She planned to expand her business to generate additional income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar and noodles for resale.

loans.name: Diana Marisol

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Diana,  tiene 29 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de cuatro  años que estudia en jardín de infantes. Ella vive en casa de los padres

Doña Diana trabaja en un almacén de la ciudad y también se dedica a la comercio, vende productos por catálogos de Avon y Lebel (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Ella sale a recorrer en sus ratos libres y también vende en el lugar donde trabaja, deja sus productos a crédito y  cobra por semana o quincenas de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes. Así ella se gana el sustento diario ya que tiene bastantes gastos porque que su bebé está enfermo y tiene que estar gastando en médicos y medicinas con mucha frecuencia. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y otros créditos que ofrece la institución. 

Su sueño es que su bebé este bien de salud.
texts.en:
The República Del Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round, as well as for being a city of incomparable beauty with many tourist attractions.

This is where Diana lives.  She is 29 years old, divorced, and she has a four-year-old son who is in kindergarden.  She lives with her parents.

Diana works at a warehouse in the city and she also works in retail, selling Avon and Lebel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) via catalog.  She goes out to sell in her free time and she also sells at work.  She sells her products on credit and she charges every week or every 15 days depending on her customers' preferences.  This is how she earns her daily living as she has many expenses because her baby is sick and she has to pay for doctor visits and medicines very often.   

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams.  She is a founder of the communal bank and she likes it because of the benefits and loans the institution offers. 

Her dream is for her child to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, and creams

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña María con 46 años de edad no deja de soñar en grande y de seguir adelante con sus proyectos propuesto a alcanzar mientras tenga vida, salud muchas fuerzas. Ella no pudo estudiar en su juventud ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron ayudarla. Ella es casada y con una numerosa familia compuesta por 6 hijos de los cuales 5 dependen aun de ella y están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación y el mayor trabaja como conductor de una unidad de bus urbano en la localidad. Ella es agricultora desde toda su vida ya que sus padres le inculcaron desde pequeña esta actividad en lo que es café, maíz y frijoles.

Ella solicita a COMIXMUL un apoyo para la compra de insumos que puedan mejorar su cosecha en general desde la raíz hasta el grano para obtener una ganancia total sobre su cultivo. 

Sus planes son los de poder mejorar sus cultivos para obtener ganancias netas re invertirlas y salir de su compromiso para así mismo poder seguir gozando de los beneficios que nuestra institución da para salir adelante. Sus sueños son los de poder darle a sus hijos la mejor educación posible con la cual ellos puedan escoger en la universidad carreras de provecho y que los ayuden a enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Maria, 46 years old, never stops dreaming big about moving forward with the projects she has taken to work on for as long as she has life, health, and great strength. She was not able to go to school when she was young because her parents had scarce resources and were not able to help her. She is married with a big family of six children, five of whom still depend on her and are going to different grades in primary school. The oldest one works as a city bus driver nearby. Maria has been a farmer her whole life because her parents instilled this work in her when she was very little. She farms coffee, corn, and beans.

She is requesting support from Kiva partner COMIXMUL to purchase supplies that can improve her overall harvest, from root to grain, so she can generate better revenue from her entire crops.

Her plan is to be able to improve her crops in order to generate better net revenue, reinvest it, and pay off her loan, as well as to continue enjoying the benefits from our institution for progressing and moving forward. Her dream is to be able to give her children the best education possible, which they can use to pursue university-level educations, which will help them better face economic challenges.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell through her buy-and-sell fish business. Minerva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en:
Oswaldo is 38 years old and married to Najjemba. He has six children and an orphan who lost his parents three years ago. Oswaldo is an agriculturalist who majors in coffee growing and owns about 4 acres of coffee plantations in his region.
 
From the income realized from coffee sales, he has managed to look after his family and, importantly, has constructed a permanent house for his family. However, Oswaldo’s biggest challenge is inadequate income to pay school fees for his children and at the same time re-invest in his business.

He is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a motorcycle to be used as a boda-boda (transport service) to enable him to mobilize more money for his children who attend formal education.

His dream is to see all his children study up to the university level. He is a hardworking and resilient man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, a 50-year-old married mother of five from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to the lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her shop in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

She is requesting a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.  With the additional income she will earn from this expansion, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her five children. 

In the future, Josephine plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a large wholesale store and be able to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, washing detergents, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, a 25-year-old single businessman in Mwingi, runs a business selling cereals and other grains. He currently lacks the capital needed to purchase items in bulk to restock his store.

With a loan through KADET LTD, Patrick will be able to purchase items in bulk such as beans, maize, sorghum, green grams, cow peas, etc. Patrick is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced recently by one of the KADET staff. Additional income created will allow him to reinvest in his business. 

In the future, Patrick would like to get married, have children and be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase items in bulk, such as beans, maize, sorghum, green grams and cow peas.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 51 years old and married with 5 children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 28 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Elma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets. Therefore, Aliya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklaces, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Annita

texts.en:
Annita is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a retail shop at Wote market in Makueni town. She also has a boutique business. She has been in this business for 9 years and currently makes a monthly income of about 6,200 Kenya Shillings. 

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to buy cereals, bread, tea leaves, basins and clothes for the boutique business. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Annita hopes to expand her business and be able to provide the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa is 45 years old, married, and lives in Balangasan, Pagadian. Her husband is a fish vendor and she is selling bagoong (salted fish) in town to earn a living. To conquer poverty, she has been in this line of business since they got married. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more homemade bagoong to sell. She hopes to open a general store in town to gain more income for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy more homemade bagoong to sell.

loans.name: Gerilyn

texts.en:
Gerilyn aims to improve her variety store to increase her income; that is why she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 and will buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, vegetables and frozen foods to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to further improve her operation of the business.

She is 32 years old and has three school-age children. Together with her husband, they aim to improve their status of living to give education to their children and uplift their living status. Despite the problems and difficulties that her family encountered in life, still they have the determination to achieve all their goals in life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, vegetables and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Kathy Aracely

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Durán.  Ella es enfermera de profesión, pero al ver que el sueldo no le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos, decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercadería para obtener otro ingreso.  Esta actividad la realiza durante sus tiempos libres.  Es soltera pero tiene una hija de 15 años, quien estudia en el colegio fiscal.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de una computadora para que le ayude en las labores escolares a su hija.
texts.en: Kathy Aracely lives in the city of Durán.  She is a nurse by profession, but since her salary does not cover her expenses she decided to sell merchandise from a catalog to obtain extra income.  She works in this business during her free time.  She is single, but she has a 15 year-old daughter who attends public school.  Kathy Aracely wants to use this loan to purchase a computer to help her daughter with her schoolwork.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter

loans.name: Norbel

texts.en: Norbel, 29 years of age, is married and they have been blessed with a child. They are harmoniously residing at the village of Mabantad. Norbel has been into selling used clothes in their village for almost 3 years, and with this she's earning a net income of about Php 500 weekly. Due to financial constraints she decided to ask for a loan amounting to Php 12,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to expand her business more to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 30 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages four and two. He bakes bread, mandazi (an East African doughnut) and cakes in his bakery, a business he started four years ago. He earns a monthly income of about KES 15,500. 

Daniel has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase an oven, bales of flour and a sack of sugar. The profit he earns will help him to repay his loan. He hopes to see his business grow and wants to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase an oven, bales of flour and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Liliana Yuliet

texts.es: Liliana a sus 30 años de edad es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Toda si vida productiva laboró como empleada en diferentes cafeterías y salsamentarías, donde adquirió experiencia y los ingresos suficientes para su sustento y el de sus padres. Es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, razón por la cual decidió independizarse y con los ahorros que había acumulado compró un negocio donde ofrece helados, comidas rápidas, gaseosas, mecato, licor, entre otros productos, esto hace ya aproximadamente 6 meses. Liliana solicita el crédito como un apoyo para el mejoramiento de su negocio, ya que lo desea invertir en la compra de activos fijos (nevera, vitrinas, enfriadores) y surtido (gaseosas, mecato, licor, cerveza, productos cárnicos, pan, etc), con esto podrá darle una mejor imagen a su negocio, que genere una percepción más positiva en las personas que transitan por la zona y tendrá disponibilidad de insumos y productos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los clientes, aumentando así sus ventas y mejorando los ingresos, esto le permitirá cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio y brindar oportunidades de empleo a  sus familiares.
texts.en:
Liliana, 30 years old, is single and doesn't have children yet. She has spent her whole working life working in different food stores and restaurants, where she has gained experience and earned sufficient income to support herself and her parents. She is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman with the desire to get ahead. It is for this reason that she decided to run her own cafe independently. She bought a business with the savings she had accumulated, where she sells ice cream, fast food, soft drinks, snacks, and liquor, among other things. She has had this business for about six months now.

Liliana is asking for this loan to make improvements to her business. She wants to invest it in fixed assets (a freezer, display cases, coolers) and stock (soft drinks, snacks, liquor, beer, meat products, bread, etc.). These purchases will improve the appearance of her business to make a more positive impression on the people who see it. She will also have supplies and stock available to satisfy the needs and tastes of her customers, allowing her to increase her sales and profits. This will let her fulfill her dreams of seeing her business grow and of offering employment opportunities to her relatives.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a freezer, display cases and coolers) and stock (soft drinks, snacks, etc.).

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El cliente corresponde a la ciudad de Durán.  La familia ha tenido el negocio desde años atrás, por lo que él lo ha aprendido desde que era pequeño.  Trabaja solo, de 7 a 9 am y de 4 a 6 pm.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo.  Tienen un hijo de 4 años que asiste a la escuela fiscal.  Necesita el dinero del crédito para adquirir útiles escolares para su hijo
texts.en: Luis Alberto lives in the city of Durán.  His family has had this business for many years, and he learned the business when he was very young.  He works alone from 7-9am and from 4-6pm.  He is married, and his wife has a business selling clothing through a catalog.  They have one 4-year old child who attends public school.  Luis Alberto needs the funds from this loan to buy school supplies for his son.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his son

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 31-year-old married mother of four children. She has been working with her husband in their grocery store for eleven years. She is a hard worker and a great mother. 

She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special summer cold beverages. This loan will improve her business a lot, especially during the holy month of Ramadan, since all the people who fast during the day will request cold beverages and drinks at night.

Nada is working hard to help her husband in developing their convenience store business, expanding their working zone, and diversifying their products to maintain an increase in income.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer cold beverages.

loans.name: Junard

texts.en: Junard lives with his family in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, he goes fishing and sells fish in the market in town. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku MPC and gained access to microfinance services. Recently, he borrowed a loan in order to repair the pump boat that he uses to fish. He hopes to generate more income in order to save a portion of his income for his family's future.

loans.use: to repair his pump boat.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is married and lives in Camanga, Tukuran with her family. She cultivates a garden, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell so that she can earn a living, and she's been working at this business for more than 7 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and buy more seeds. In 2010, Roselyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Roselyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and buy more seeds.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks in her community. This is her way of helping her husband to generate a daily income for their everyday needs. She is now 50 years old and has three adult children. Due to financial constraints, Elsa is requesting for a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional business capital to improve her business. 

With the loan, she plans to buy meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and other ingredients needed to prepare food to sells. With patience and hard work, she believes that she will be able to succeed in her food selling business.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, fish, seasonings and other ingredients needed to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in the area of Nkubu in eastern Kenya, a very resourceful area for agriculture located along the slopes of Mt.Kenya. He is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. He has practiced mixed farming for 28 years. His main sources of income are tea leaves, coffee, bananas, maize, and potatoes.

He wants to venture into fish farming and thus has requested Juhudi Kilimo to help him fund this project. This loan will generate more income, improving his family's living standards and providing a better education for his child. The major challenge that he faces is inadequate funds. He says that in the next five years, he will buy a posho mill.

Robert says that he will make maximum use of Juhudi Kilimo's funds to boost his production.

loans.use: to practice fish farming.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 50-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling embroidery material eight years ago. 

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of embroidery products, including pearls, coloured threads, etc., so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery products to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 30 years old, married and the father of a three-year-old child. He runs a pool table business, which he has been doing for the past two years, and earns a monthly income of KES 39,990. 

This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase another pool table and the anticipated profit to expand his business. 

He hopes to expand his business and educate his child at all levels.

loans.use: to purchase another pool table for his pool table business.

loans.name: Progress Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Nelia from Mutare. Nelia belongs to Progress Sisters Group. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school.  

Nelia runs a retail business which sells clothes (babywear, ladies’ suits) and footwear. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenge being faced is stiff competition on the market. 

Nelia has requested a loan of $600 to buy clothes and footwear for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general welfare of her family. In the future, Nelia plans to own a boutique shop in town.		
	
Nelia is holding her own baby, and she is a member of Progress group.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is married and has six children. She is 43 years old and lives in Tukuran, Philippines. To earn a living, Matilde operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been doing this for more than seven years, and she earns 6,000 PHP every month from this work. In addition to this, she also has a sari sari store selling goods to earn extra income. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair a vehicle used in the business. In 2008, Matilde joined GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transportation vehicle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old woman, married to Patrick and a mother of three children. She lives in Kangemi on the outskirts of Nairobi. She sells secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for fifteen years and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be Mary’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more bales of used clothing for resale. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business so that she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a hog-raiser in the village of San Ambrocio. He has been in this business for three years. He is now 52 years old, but still strong and determined to work harder to keep his business growing and provide a better living to his family, especially his children. 

Carlos opted to have more hogs to raise. However, he had not enough capital, and is thus requesting a loan from lenders in the amount of PHP 11,000. He will use the loan to buy additional piglets and their needed feed and vaccines, so that they will grow healthier for future breeding and sale.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and their needed feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Gina manages a general store while her husband operates his tricycle transportation. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC. Gina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items like feed, rice and corn grits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items like feed, rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Angélica Virginia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal República Del Ecuador se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 4 y 3  años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. El marido es guardia de seguridad.
 
Doña Angélica se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos porque sus hijos están en la escuela y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeñito, ella deja a crédito y  cobra semanalmente. Lleva 6 años en esta actividad con la cual  puede pagar ciertas cosas de los estudios de sus hijos y que con lo que gana su marido no les alcanza.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal 2 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Republic of Ecuador Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are highly visited throughout the year and for being a beautiful city without equal, with many tourist attractions.

Angélica lives in this city. She is 33 years old and she lives in a common law marriage from which she has three children who are 9, 4 and 3 years old. The two older children study in school and kindergarten. Her husband is a security guard.

Angélica works selling products from Avon and Belcorp (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). Her method of sales is door to door. She works every day, mostly in the morning hours because those hours are the easiest for her routes because her children are in school. She only has to bring the youngest child with her. She sells on credit and is paid on a weekly basis. She has been doing this work for 6 years. With her earnings she can pay for certain expenses for the schooling of her children that her husband cannot afford based on his earnings.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been in the Communal Bank for 2 years and she likes it because of the help the loans provide her. Her dream is to improve the lives of her children.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 35 years old, married with four children. He is an agriculturalist who majors in cattle fattening in his region and owns 100 cows of which 40 are for diary and 60 are for beef. He has managed to look after his family and also help paying school fees for his young brother, the responsibility he took over after realizing at the age of his parents they could not manage to raise the necessary support. Wilson is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy materials to finish up his house and be able to have a decent living together with his increasing family.

Wilson’s major challenge is the poor housing condition at the moment for his four children. Wilson lacks a decent house. “My grass thatched house can’t accommodate my increasing family members. Given 2,000,000 UGX, I will be able to finish my house and live a happy life," says Wilson.

His dream is to own one of the largest farms in his region, producing 300 liters of milk a day. Wilson is an honest and a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Malik Hospital Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and six children. 

Her husband has owned a printing press since 2001, along with his two sons. This printing is for books, newspapers, magazines, and other reading materials to be produced in great numbers, and it plays an important role in promoting literacy among the masses. 

One of her sons has become an expert in his profession and can easily operate a printing machine alone. She wants to buy a new printing machine for her son, so that the monthly income would grow, but her earning capacity and savings discourage her to do this act. 

Shazia decided to take a loan and present her request to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she could contribute this amount, along with her savings, and buy a new printing machine. She hopes that this loan will become the cause of establishment of business and increments in savings as well.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Felix put up a small variety store in his village to generate an income. He is 32 years old and still single. He aims to become successful and financially stable in order to have a bright future for his future family. 

Felix plans to improve his store and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, assorted candies, soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, soaps, noodles and seasonings to sell in his local business. 

Through this financial assistance, he strongly believes that he will improve his business, and hopes that someday he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, assorted candies, soft drinks, beverages, canned goods, soaps, noodles and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Power Drive Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Cynthia from Mutare. She is married with three children and they are all attending school. She belongs to Power Drive Group. Cynthia runs a retail business, which sells groceries. The business has been in operation for five years. She says that the main challenge she faces is stiff competition from larger retailers and supermarkets. Cynthia has requested a loan of $500 to buy some groceries (sugar, rice, cooking oil, etc.) for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to boost her business and to improve the general welfare of the family. In the future, Cynthia plans to open other branches within the province.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie's source of income is through her service-based business, which provides tricycle transportation and rental. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She lives in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to acquire another unit of tricycle to be used for expansion. She hopes to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to acquire another unit of tricycle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 37 years old. She is married to David and blessed with three children ages 12, 9, and 5 years old, respectively. She owns a hotel and grocery stall. She started her business five years ago, and it earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. Jane wants to boost her business and has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to aid her in her purchase of grocery items to use in her hotel. The profit that she earns will help her to purchase a piece of land. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to use in her hotel.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
While Bukurije would like to thank lenders for their previous financial assistance, which enabled her to buy fodder for her animals, she is in need for your precious help again, this time to buy feed for her animals. She has just re-paid the previous loan in full.

Thanks again for your help:)

loans.use: to stock up on fodder for animals

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is a 59-year-old married woman that lives in Man-ilan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. To make a living, she owns and manages a retail store selling an assorted variety of fruits. She has been doing this for many years. In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and is now requesting a loan to buy ripened mangoes, bananas, and more fruits for sale. She plans to expand her business and use her generated income to repair her house in order to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy ripened mangoes, bananas, and more fruits for sale

loans.name: Asmeen's Group

texts.en:
Asmeen is a 35-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He sells onions, carrots, potatoes and chilies in his shop. 

Presently, Asmeen’s husband is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Asmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Asmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables from the field to sell in the market at a profitable price.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 35-year-old woman from the Baghdati district. She lives with her brother and her parents. Her parents are provided for, with a retirement pension. Liana graduated from pharmaceutical college and works as a pharmacist at a local pharmacy as well as, at the same time, a nurse at a local hospital. Unfortunately, she is the only person working in the family and her salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of four. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start her own business with a loan. However, the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Liana’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received credit through the joint initiative, the Kiva and Credo-Startup Program, which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 1,500 GEL, she will purchase beehives with bee-colonies. The family will start producing honey and will be able to increase its income. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon is 38 years old. He and his wife are happy and have two children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Rustamjon has been farming for three years, producing vegetables and crops. He has developed his business step by step. In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, Rustamjon is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 1,000 USD so that he can buy a combine harvester and continue improving his crop production. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a combine (combine harvester) for his farming business

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 30-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling embroidery material eight years ago. 

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of embroidery products including pearls, colored threads, etc. so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Samina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery materials.

loans.name: El Buen Sembrador-Cruz B Group

texts.es:
Santos es el representante del Grupo  El Buen Sembrador- Cruz B (de sweater corinto, primero de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía) es un  hombre  casado, de 50 años de edad, vive junto a sus 9 hijos (5 hombres y 4 mujeres) y su esposa en el Paraje Cruz B, Pamezabal, municipio de Santa Lucía Utatlán, Sololá. 
El  es un hombre trabajador y amable, comenta que se dedica a la siembra de maíz en la comunidad donde vive, esta labor la heredó de sus padres y lleva 30 años realizándola.
Gracias al cultivo de maíz que realiza el puede alimentar a su familia y el excedente producido lo comercializa en el mercado local y le genera ingresos para cubrir otros gastos como vestimenta y educación.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para poder remodelar su vivienda y así darle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a representative of the Good Grower Group (he is wearing a purple sweater, he is the second person from the left in the photograph). He is married and is 50 years old. He lives with his 9 children (5 men and 4 women) and his wife in the neighborhood "Cruz B" in Pamezabal in the municipality of Santa Lucía Utatlán, Sololá. 

He is a friendly and hardworking man. He told us that he works growing corn in the community where he lives. He inherited this work from his parents and he has been doing it for 30 years. Thanks to the corn he grows he can successfully feed his family and he sells the surplus corn in the local market which generates earnings to cover the other household expenses like clothing and education.

He and the other members of the group will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer to grow corn. His dream is to generate more earnings so he can remodel his home and through this provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives in the Litein area of eastern Kenya, a very productive area for agriculture. He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has practiced farming for 20 years. His main source of income is cash crops, cereals, and horticultural crops.

He has requested a loan of KES 10,000, which will help him fund his project of purchasing and installing water pipes on the farm.These pipes will help him to water his crops easily, especially during seasons of drought. This will lead to an increase in production and thus, an increase in income. This will help him educate his children easily. His major challenges are insufficient funds and poor markets. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for the low interest rate loans and quick processing of loans.

loans.use: To purchase and install water pipes

loans.name: Saidnazar

texts.en:
Saidnazar is 24 years old. He is married and has one child to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that one year ago he began his own business driving a taxi. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to buy a new Mark OPEL car. 

In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which allows him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his taxi business

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Jona successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Jona's business again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is 33 years old and married with three school-age children. She manages a simple school canteen to make a living. Despite her life's difficulties, Claris remains strong and determined in uplifting her family from their poor living situation. Her husband, on the other hand, is currently working abroad. They plan to earn and save some of their income for their house renovation and education of their children. 

Her capital in the store is not enough, so Claris is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of food snacks, assorted candies, soft drinks, spaghetti noodles, bananas, and sweet potatoes that she cooks and sells in the school canteen.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of food snacks, assorted candies, soft drinks, spaghetti noodles, bananas, and sweet potatoes that she cooks and sells in the school canteen.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
San Juan gracias al esfuerzo de cada una de las integrantes esta ya en su cuarto ciclo, mejorando cada vez mas y asistiendo a las capacitaciones. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación integral de cada una de las integrantes.
Fabia, es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, quien por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo esta mejorando su emprendimiento. Ella tiene una pequeña pero bien surtida despensa en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y la cual es el principal sustento de su familia. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero con su esfuerzo, y sumado a la ayuda de su familia ha ido mejorando.
La Sra. Fabia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos en general, para poder surtir su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Thanks to the hard work of each of the members of the San Juan group, the organization is in its fourth lending cycle. Things are improving each cycle and they are attending the trainings. The women make up a broad survey of the elimination of poverty through knowledge of the individual situation each member finds themselves in. 

Fabia is one of the members of the group. She is a hard worker and a fighter who, through her work and strength is improving her entrepreneurship. She has a small but well stocked dispensary where she works starting very early in the morning and which is the primary support for her family. She told us that she began with very little, but with her efforts and the addition of help from her family, things have been improving. 

Fabia seeks this loan to buy general supplies, to supply her store, like drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruits and more. These would help her to solidify her business plan which would help her to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, vegetables, fruits and more.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Cayetano está en su ciclo número  quinto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Claudia  quien esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, y con lo cual podrá ayudar a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
La Sra Claudia solicita de este crédito para la compra de Panificados, verduras, carne, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y también poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group is in its fifth cycle with the women’s committee program, where all of them work and help each other get ahead.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey in order to be able to know about each of their situations.  Two members are below the poverty line, which is to say they have very low incomes.

Claudia is one of them, and she is completing the poverty elimination survey.  She says that she sells food that she makes herself.  By doing this she will be able to help her family and give them everything they need day to day.

Claudia is requesting this loan to buy baked good, vegetables, and meat, etc.  This will help her to have a firm business plan.  That will help her to improve her income and also be able to continue meeting her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy baked good, vegetables, and meat, etc.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is 52 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Greta has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Greta requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Greta has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Greta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy  vive en pareja, tiene 1 hijo menor; ella  empezó trabajando con su tía como costurera y de quien aprendió el oficio.
Luego de varios años de trabajo lograron  comprar para  sus maquinas en cuotas mensuales, con mucho sacrificio pudo independizase y realizar esta tarea  con el esposo.
Gracias a este trabajo pudieron construir para su casa; darle una buena educación a su hijo y llevar una vida digna. Nancy  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Comenta que a dos  familias le da trabajo como ayudante en el barrio donde vive.
Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de telas  y también para el mantenimiento de sus maquinas. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her life partner and has one minor child.  She started working as a seamstress with her aunt, and she learned the profession from her.  Then, after several years of work they managed to buy their machines with monthly payments.  With a great deal of sacrifice, she was able to become independent and do this work with her husband.

Thanks to this work they were able to build their house, give their son a good education, and lead a decent life.  Nancy has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible and honest person with her commitments.  She states that she gives work as a helper to two families in the neighborhood where she lives.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and for maintenance on her machines.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving because it will be a lot of help in getting better income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and to perform maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo tiene 53 años, está casado con la Sra. Miriam , con quien tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad, y que gracias al esfuerzo de la pareja ya son personas de bien que les ayuda.
Don Hugo empezó a trabajar como secretario ayudante en un taller mecánico  cuando tenía apenas 13 años  donde después de varios años de experiencia  decidió  independizarse y trabajar por cuenta propia. Hoy  día  nos cuenta que hace 40 años ya  que está en esta actividad y en su taller propio y con esfuerzo esta creciendo cada día mas.
El crédito solicitado fue para compra de un terreno que linda con su propiedad, para poder de esa forma expandir su taller y tener una mayor capacidad para recibir a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Don Hugo is 53 and married to Doña Miriam, the mother of his two adult children. Both are very hard working people known for integrity that helps him as a businessman. 

Don Hugo began working as an assistant in an auto repair shop when he was just 13. He decided to go into business for himself after he'd gained a few years of experience. Don Hugo tells us that he's run his own shop for 40 years and that his efforts have resulted in steady growth of the business.

Don Hugo is applying for a loan to purchase a property that adjoins his shop. With the additional space, he can expand his shop and will be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: Comprar propiedad para ampliar taller mecánico

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas ponen todos sus esfuerzos para ir creciendo y mejorando cada día en los emprendimientos que hacen. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas, abocadas a ayudar a sus familias.
Una persona digna de destacar es Reina, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, ya que tiene una mercería, y también una librería. Comenta que tiene  muy buena clientela, ya que siempre su negocio esta bien surtido con todo tipo de productos. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo para dar a su familia todo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuadernos, lápices, ropas interiores, etc. para cargar más su negocio y posterior reventa.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this committee have various activities. Each of them puts all of her efforts into growing and improving their enterprises every day. They are hardworking women who are focused on helping their families.   

One noteworthy person is Reina. She works selling all types of products, since she has a notions store and a bookstore. She says that she has very good clientele, since her business is always well stocked with all types of products. Her goal is to keep working and growing to giver family everything. 

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying notebooks, pencils, underwear, etc. to stock her business more and later sell the items.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Susana

texts.es: Hilda, a sus 64 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de mercancía como perfumes, blusas, zapatos, accesorios, cremas corporales, entre otros, actividad que realiza desde su casa, con esto ha obtenido los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia durante todo ese tiempo. Hilda, es una señora juiciosa, emprendedora, dedicada a su familia y  su negocio, siempre va buscando opciones que le permitan progresar al lado de los que ama, por esto se motiva a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, ropa, zapatos, sandalias, cosméticos ,entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar el descuento que le hacen y así poder tener la disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, aumentando así el margen de utilidad y los ingresos para seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar. Hilda, como todas las personas lucha día a día por alcanzar sus metas, en este caso, desea montar su negocio en un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad donde reside, que sea muy comercial y transitado, para así lograr un reconocimiento y aumentar sus ventas, lo que le permitiría mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Hilda, age 64, has four children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner.  She has been selling merchandise like perfume, blouses, shoes, accessories, and body creams, among others, for 20 years.  She carries out her business activity from her house, and with it she has obtained the income to support her family during all of this time.

Hilda is a sensible and enterprising woman who is devoted to her family and her business.  She is always looking for options that will allow her to make progress by the side of her loved ones.  

That is why she is motivated to request the loan to buy merchandise wholesale (perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, and cosmetics, among others).  She will do this in order to take advantage of the discount that they give.  This way she will be able to have products available to satisfy her customers’ preferences.  She will be increasing her profit margin and her income in order to continue contributing to the household finances.

Hilda, like all people, struggles day to day to achieve her goals.  In this case, she wishes to set up her business in her own place located in the center of the city where she lives.  She wants it to be in a a very commercial and busy place.  This is so that she will manage to be well-known and to increase her sales.  This would allow her to improve the quality of life for her whole family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, and cosmetics, among others).

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 33 years old, married, and has six dependents. Three of his dependents come from a very needy home owned by an old man. He deals in cattle fattening and milking because his major source of income is from his 70 diary cows. It's through milk sales that Fred has managed to look after his family and his parents. He provides them with medication, pays tuition for his school-going children, and is constructing a permanent house for the family.

Fred is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cows for milk, to increase his milk production and also buy vet drugs for the cows. His major challenge is the dry season, which leads to inadequate grass to feed his animals and a lack of water (due to the prolonging dry season) which leads to a decrease in milk supply. His dream is to own a milk-cooling plant in his region. Fred is very hardworking. In the photo is Fred (left) with the Ugafode credit officer at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for milk production

loans.name: María Oliva

texts.es: Oliva, con 65 años de edad quedó viuda tras la muerte de su esposo, es madre de 4 hijos y tiene 8 nietos. Desde el año 2004, luego de haber quedado sin la compañía de su esposo, ella decidió abrir su propio negocio de venta de comidas, elaboradas por ella misma, como tamales, morcilla, chorizo, arepa con carne desmechada entre otros, debido a que vio la necesidad de sentirse útil y por su edad, le era difícil conseguir oportunidades de empleo. Actualmente, su negocio ha ido creciendo gracias al empuje, a la dedicación y el empeño con el que Oliva ha trabajado día a día, con entusiasmo y espíritu de superación, sin descuidar lo más importante, su familia. Es así como Oliva ha logrado conseguir los recursos para el sustento de su hogar,  y se motiva para solicitar otro crédito como un apoyo al crecimiento de su negocio, el cual será invertido en la mejora de los activos fijos (ollas, vajilla, herramientas de cocina) y comprará gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, todo esto con el fin de poder brindar a sus clientes un servicio de excelente calidad y tendrá disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los comensales. Esto le ayudará a aumentar sus ventas y ser más competitiva en el mercado, así irá avanzando paso a paso hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, tener su negocio adecuado con un estilo campestre dentro de la ciudad, donde sus clientes sientan un ambiente cálido, acogedor y muy familiar, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oliva is 65 years old, a widow, the mother of four and grandmother to 8 children. In 2004, after losing her husband, she decided to open her own business selling meals. Food that she makes herself, such as tamales, blood sausage, Spanish sausage, arepas with shredded meat (a stuffed flat corn flour traditional food) amongst others. She started her business because she wanted to feel useful but at her age jobs are hard to come by. At the present her business is growing thanks to Oliva's energy, dedication and determination. She labors daily with enthusiasm and a spirit of getting ahead, without forgetting what is most important, her family. 

In this way Olivia has managed to earn the money to support her household and is motivated to ask for another loan to support the growth of her business.
