She will use the loan to buy fixed assets (pots, dishes, cooking utensils) as well as purchasing pop and beer wholesale. Her goal is to offer her customers excellent service and to have the products on hand to satisfy the demands of her clientele. This will help her increase her sales and be more competitive in her market. Thus advancing step by step towards her dream, which is to have a nice business with a country style, inside the city. Where her clients can enjoy a warm, friendly, family atmosphere and she can enjoy economic stability and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to improve her fixed assets (buy pots, dishes and cooking utensils) and to buy pop and beer wholesale.

loans.name: Jelly Demetria

texts.en:
Jelly Demetria is 58 years old and now a widow. She was gifted with four children and they live happily in a rural community. Due to the hardship of living, she puts up a small variety store in their village to generate income for their needs. 

Jelly Demetria aims to increase her product offerings, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional business capital of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, food snacks, assorted candies, beverages, soft drinks, and seasonings to sell. She hopes that her loan will be granted in order to make further improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, food snacks, assorted candies, beverages, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, 28, is single and lives with her parents and pensioner grandma in the town of Telavi in East Georgia. Tamar’s mother is a vegetable retailer and owns a stall in the capital city open market. Her father is an artisan and works on special orders. They earn a small monthly income. 

Tamar stays home and takes care of her family, but she’s a very enthusiastic young woman and wants to generate her own income and help the family. The existing income, though, is not enough to cover everyday expenses So, Tamar decided to start up a grocery store but found that she didn't have enough money to do so. 

Unfortunately, Tamar was unable to obtain a loan from an existing financial institutions, as they required a stable income and business experience as a precondition to a loan. But Tamar has now received her loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides start-up and re-start up loans with easy terms to the country's vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit. 

With a loan of 2,400 USD Tamar will purchase groceries to stock the store. Tamar will care for her clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. With this determination and her loan she expects to improve her income and give her family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis lives in Man-ilan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. He studied BSBA in Aurora Pioneer Memorial College (APMC). His father worked as a security guard while his mother is the chairman in the barangay. Their income is not enough to support all the needs for there are four that are still studying. 

To cover the costs of study materials and tuition fees, Dennis borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). Dennis is very much thankful to GDMPC for granting loans to students who are courageous and eager to pursue ambitions, despite hindrances. 

Dennis wants to work in any company in the future, so that he can help his parents and his brothers' and sisters' educations.

loans.use: to cover the costs of study materials and tuition fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Jamás Serán Vencidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Mujeres Unidas jamás serán vencidas está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante e ir mejorando la vida de cada una y la de su familia.
Elva es peluquera y tiene una clientela bien amplia, ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos y quedan muy conformes. Es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por su familia para poder darles lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ella quiere seguir agrandando su negocio y también así poder dar trabajo a otras personas de su comunidad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, peines, y demás insumos para seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes el buen servicio al que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group will never give up.  They are in their third cycle with the women’s committee program.  They are all working and helping each other to get ahead and to improve each of their lives and those of their families.

Elva is a hairdresser, and she has a lot of customers.  This is because she always does very good work, and her customers are very satisfied.  She is a very hard-working person who puts forth her effort for her family.  She does this in order to be able to give them what they need and so that they will never do without.  She wants to continue enlarging her business, and she also wants to be able to give work to other people in her community.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, combs, and other supplies in order to continue offering her customers the good service to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, combs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fanny works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and farming vegetables. Fanny is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Fanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Hamomiddin

texts.en:
Hamomiddin is a hardworking and generous man. He is 36 years old. He has worked at the aluminum factory since 1999. There are six people in his family: he lives with his wife and his four children, boys and girls. His wife is a housewife and does not have a source of income. 

Since last year, Hamomiddin has been rebuilding his house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. He must make a roof for his house. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to covering some missing building materials, such as wood and slate, to make the roof of his family house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy slate and wood for making a roof for his house

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, 35, is married with four children. She resides in Tabuan, Tukuran, in the Philippines. 

She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale, while her husband provides tricycle transportation in the community to earn a living. In 2010, she joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to access financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

Elvie has requested a loan of 22,500 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 51 years old. He lives with his father in the small village of Kharagauli district. His father is 85 years old and is provided with a retirement pension. Koba requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Koba is involved in agricultural activities. He has a vineyard and produces wine for selling. In addition, he has a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Koba requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Koba has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-start up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

With the received credit, Koba will purchase pigs and feed for them. After the pigs are purchased, he will fatten them and slaughter them in wintertime to sell meat. This will increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of biscuits, candies, breads, beverages, canned goods, noodles, eggs, fruits, and vegetables to offer daily in her simple store.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is married and has four children. She is 41 years old and lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Mely owns and operates a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 8 years. Recently. she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, milk, and biscuits.

In 2011, Mely joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and be able to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca runs a sari sari store (general store) in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 42 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a fisherman, and she helps him earn a living. 

Rebecca joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative in 2011, and it has helped her improve her living situation and engage in business. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional goods like sugar, oil, milk and coffee. She plans to save a portion of her income for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like sugar, oil, milk and coffee

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and five children (two sons and three daughters) in Nablus city. All of her children are under 18 and go to school. Sabah's husband works as a teacher at a University. Sabah lives with her family in an old house which needs some repair. 
Sabah has taken a USD loan from Kiva partner FATEN and this loan will help her to pay the costs of repairing the family home especially the ceiling. This will help the family to live in better conditions. 

Sabah appears in the photo with her children in front of their home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing the family home especially the ceiling

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Dalia is a 24-year-old single woman from Ramallah. She lives with her family in a very humble house. Dalia's father is a worker with a low wage, this wage does not cover all the family needs. Dalia and her family would like to improve their house. it is in a very bad condition now and a lot of things in it need to be fixed and repaired.

Dalia has taken a USD loan from Kiva partner FATEN. This loan will help her to change the sewage networks in the home. This will offer them better living conditions especially the health conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs of changing the sewage networks for the family home.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina  is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur in the Philippines. She is 47 years old and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Clementina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not her only means of income, Clementina's main revenue comes from buying and selling dried fish and vegetables in the local community. 

In 2008, Clementina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could help her engage in business activities that would improve her living situation. Clementina has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

Clementina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she'll use to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile phone cards.  

Amelia is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional items like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and spices for her general store.

Amelia has sustained her business activities through 22 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and spices

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52-years-old and is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Letecia has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Letecia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Onisa Isabel

texts.es: Isabel con 44 años de edad, es una mujer separada y madre de un hijo de 15 años. Desde hace 15 años aproximadamente se dedica a la actividad de la confección, gracias a las enseñanzas de una familiar que le enseñó la labor. Luego de la separación con su esposo, ella ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, ya que le corresponde sacar adelante a su hijo sin ningún tipo de apoyo, pero ella con gran esfuerzo, dedicación y muchas ganas de salir adelante ha logrado sobrepasar los obstáculos. Isabel solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su negocio y lo desea invertir en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, encajes) con el fin de tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos para satisfacer los requerimientos y gustos de sus clientes, así podrá tener más contratos y mejorar los ingresos. Con esto podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es hacer crecer su negocio, prestando un excelente servicio y ofrecer productos bien terminados, que le permita un reconocimiento en el sector y complementarlo con un almacén donde pueda vender las prendas que elabora, de esta manera podrá ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación y bienestar.
texts.en: Isabel, 44, is separated and has a 15-year-old son. She has worked in sewing for about 15 years, thanks to lessons from a family member who taught her this work. After the separation from her husband, she went through a difficult economic situation, since she had to move her son forward without any kind of help. But, with a lot of effort, dedication, and the will to move forward, she has managed to overcome obstacles. Isabel is asking for the loan as support to continue with her business and she wants to purchase supplies wholesale (fabrics, thread, lace) with the goal of having a variety of products available to meet the needs and tastes of her customers. This way, she will be able to have more contracts and increase her income. She will be able to make progress towards achieving her dream, which is growing her business, providing excellent service and offering well-finished products. This will let her have some recognition in her area. She wants to complement it with a warehouse where she can sell the garments that she makes. This way, she will be able to offer to son a better education and comfort.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabrics, thread, lace)

loans.name: Leydy Astrid

texts.es: Astrid, a sus 27 años de edad vive en unión libre con su pareja y aún no tiene hijos. Por falta de oportunidades laborales, ha decidido iniciar su propio negocio de comidas rápidas, para ubicarlo inicialmente en la acera de su casa, aprovechando la ventaja de no tener competencia cercana, por este motivo solicita su primer ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de un carrito de perros por valor de $800.000, silletería por $100.000 y sombrilla e insumos (pan, carnes frías, salsas, queso) por valor de $100.000, de está forma podrá comenzar su negocio con buenas adecuaciones y ofrecer productos de buena calidad a sus clientes y transeúntes del sector donde reside; de esta forma logrará obtener ingresos para apoyar la carga económica en su hogar y salir adelante al lado de su esposo. Astrid sueña con tener su posicionar su negocio, caracterizándose por prestar un excelente servicio y ofrecer productos de buena calidad, para luego ampliarlo y montarlo en un local propio, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor estabilidad económica y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Astrid is 27 years old and lives with her partner. She does not have any children yet. Because of the lack of job opportunities in her area, she has decided to set up her own fast food business. She will start on the sidewalk outside her house, taking advantage of the lack of competition nearby. She is requesting her first loan to buy to set up a food cart, buying a hotdog stand for 800,000 pesos, tables and chairs for 100,000 pesos, and an umbrella and supplies (bread, meat, sauces, cheese) for 100,000 pesos. That way, she will be able to start out prepared and offer high-quality products to customers and passersby in her neighborhood. The income will allow her to contribute to the household economically and help her and her husband to move forward in life. Astrid dreams of having a successful business that offers excellent service and high-quality products; she would like to expand it and set up in a real restaurant space that will give her more financial stability and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to set up a food cart, buying a hotdog stand, tables and chairs, an umbrella, and supplies (bread, meat, sauces, cheese).

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom are of school-going age. She has practiced farming for 12 years. Her main sources of income are milk, tea, and bananas.

She wants to venture into poultry farming and so, has requested a loan of 60,000 KES in order to start the project. This project will bring in more production and thus increase her income base, hence improving her family's standard of living and giving better education to her children. The major challenge she faces is drought seasons, pests, and diseases.

Catherine says that Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro-finance Institution for her.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 35-year-old housewife with 3 children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He is an electronics seller. He sells a variety of electronic goods in his shop. He needs to purchase more materials for his shop. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult.

Therefore, his wife Zubaida, as a member of a two person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the help of the loan amount, her husband will purchase electronic wires and switches. Zubaida hopes that the loan will be productive for her family and her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electronic wires and switches

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the wholesale market and then sells it to the people of her vicinity at reasonable prices. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Naseem has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kiva partner Kashf Foundation in order to buy a stock of different printed cloths for the summer season taking in account the choices and tastes of her customers. It’s her 10th loan cycle and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to earn more profits and will use the profit for her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock of different printed cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio, a sus 56 años de edad es padre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Por falta de oportunidades laborales decidió iniciar su negocio para obtener recursos por sí mismo y desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a ser vendedor ambulante, su principal mercado depende de los eventos, concierto y actividades culturales que se realicen en la ciudad, él lleva un carro artesanal de tracción manual donde porta sus neveras de icopor portátiles y va ofreciendo gaseosas y cervezas en lata y licor. Con esto ha logrado obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el alimento a su hogar, brindarle una educación básica a su hijo y pagar las cuentas mensuales.  Ignacio es un señor trabajador, activo y siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida, lucha constantemente para salir adelante con su familia, enfrentando las inclemencias del clima que se han convertido en su principal desafío pero, a pesar de todo siempre está buscando opciones que le permitan avanzar y por eso solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas y licor) y cambiar las neveras de icopor que ya están deterioradas, así podrá continuar con la actividad que lo ha sacado de situaciones difíciles durante largos años. Ignacio anhela cumplir el sueño de montar una licorera en un local propio, donde pueda estar más cómodo y seguro y, que le permita mejorar sus ingresos  para brindarle a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 56, is father to a son and lives with his partner in a free union. Lacking employment opportunity, he decided to open a business to earn a living. He has been a street merchant for 10 years, and his target market depends on events, concerts, and other activities held in the city. He uses a hand-push cart to haul his portable polystyrene containers and sell sodas, canned beer, and liquor. He has managed to earn enough to support his family, give his son a basic education, and pay monthly bills. 

Ignacio is hardworking, active, and always positive about life. He strives to get ahead along with his family and face bad weather, which has become his major challenge. Despite everything, he always looks for chances to succeed, so he has applied for his second loan cycle. He will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise (sodas, beer, and alcohol) and to buy polystyrene containers to replace worn ones so that he can continue with this job, which has gotten him through tough times over the years. Ignacio dreams of opening his own liquor store, where he would be more comfortable and safer, and which would let him earn more so that he can ensure that his son has the chance for a better education and that his family has a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (sodas, beer, and alcohol) and to buy polystyrene containers.

loans.name: Elizbath

texts.en:
Elizbath is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of bed cover sales for many years. She purchases a variety of blankets and bed covers from the main city in bulk then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality blankets in her community.

She requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kiva partner Kashf Foundation in order to buy more stock of bed covers, blankets and spreads in different colors and designs. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bed covers, blankets and spreads in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education.  She, with her husband, has been engaged in agriculture for many years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market.  

Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kiva partner the Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, Ameeran has applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000/-. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 40 year old married woman. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: This time, Erlinda is borrowing a new loan of 15,000 PHP in order to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF, Kiva's partner, continues to provide for Erlinda and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Mary Russel

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Mary Russel buys and sells vegetables to help her husband by gaining income. She is 23-years-old and has one child. They live happily in a rural community and make their living through farming and her vegetable selling business.

Together with her husband, she works hard and patiently endures life's difficulties in improving their source of living in order to satisfy their necessities. Due to financial constraints, Mary Russel is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy various vegetables such as eggplant, bitter melon, okra, tomatoes, taro, pechay, beans and cabbages to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted so she can go on reaching for her business endeavor.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, bitter melon, okra, tomatoes, taro, pechay, beans and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes and kale to sell.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Amna is an energetic married woman. She has been running a small business of animal sales and purchase. She has been doing this business for the past five years. She buys animals (baby goats and cows) at low prices, raises them, and then her husband sells them out in the market.

She manages her household expenses by operating a business. In order to expand her business she has requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 in order to buy one more goat. She is very experienced and has maintained good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to buy one more goat.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 28-years-old and married with a three-year-old child.  He owns a retail shop in the Eldama/Ravine location and it has been in operation for a period of six years earning an income of Kes 20,000 monthly.

He has borrowed his second loan of Kes 80,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD and he intends to use this amount to purchase stock including rice, cooking fat and detergents to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his current business.

He hopes for growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock including rice, cooking fat and detergents.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 37-year-old married woman. She is running a small general store in her community with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have years of experience in this field and offer various goods for daily use. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and by dealing with customers sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their six children. Currently, Mumtaz requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya, a very rich area for agriculture, located at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has practiced farming for 15 years. Her main source of income is milk and cereals, which she sells in the local market. She also has a tailoring business as an extra source of income.

She wants to improve the supply of water on her farm and, as such, she wants to put up a water tank, so that there will be an easy supply of water on the farm. Because of this, she has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the project. This will improve her production and, thus, her income level will increase. Increased income will help her educate her children more easily. The major challenges she faces are poor infrastructure, pests, and diseases. In the next five years, she plans to start a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 51-year-old energetic lady. She has been successfully running a small general store to support her entire family. Her store is located at the corner of her house where she offers a variety of grocery items of daily use at a reasonable price. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To keep her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR which she will use to buy packs of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Marilou has been in this business for 12 years. Marilou earns additional income from a buy-and-sell seaweed business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 28-year-old woman, married to Samuel and a mother of one lovely child. She is a fruit vendor in Uthiru in the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for ten years and gets a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be Emily's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy fruits like watermelon, oranges, pineapples, etc. in bulk. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk

loans.name: Reaz

texts.en: Reaz had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Four years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Due to this problem, she applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR through the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces and zippers, to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and fungicide for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta, 63, is married with three adult children. She is a hardworking woman who relies on her vulcanizing shop and her hat-making business for her living. (Vulcanizing is the process of converting rubber and other materials into stronger substances.) These businesses started eight years ago. 

Marta is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy more burri and rubber for vulcanizing. She hopes, with available materials, she can be more productive each day for better business profitability.
 
In the future, she hopes to be in the same business but able to expand her production. Her income will provide food for her and her husband, who is also her partner in the business.

loans.use: to buy more burri and rubber for vulcanizing

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 25-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has two children; both are school-going. It was very tough for Rabia to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose, she started her business of cloth sales, as she buys cloths of different varieties from Lahore and Faisalabad markets and then resells in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. 

In order to inflate her sales, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors and designs, taking in account the taste and choice of her customers. It's her third year with Kashf Foundation. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Merelin

texts.en:
Merelin is 31 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Merelin has a food vending business in the Philippines. Merelin requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Merelin has been in this business for four years. In the future, Merelin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes owns and manages a small variety store to generate income. She is 36 years old and has one school-age child. She aims to have a bright future and she believes that being happy and successful in every business endeavor will greatly influence this.

For this reason, she works hard and is very patient in managing her general store. She uses the income generated from her store for her family’s daily needs. 

She plans to further improve the business to satisfy her family’s necessities and provide her child with an education. However, she has not enough capital. 

Thus, she is asking for additional business capital from lenders, in the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos, to buy soap, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and other products to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, shampoo, snack foods, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings and other products to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Francisca works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Francisca is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like margarine, sugar, flour and others for her bakery business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like margarine, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es: Claudia de 31 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposo y es madre de un recién nacido.  Actualmente vive en  casa humilde pero propia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora, audaz que siempre se caracteriza por cumplir sus metas y objetivos a seguir. Tiene ya 3 años de vivir en su hogar y desea mucho poder mejorarla pues desea comprar derechos de agua potable y de luz eléctrica, además mejorar un poco su hogar,  para que no tengan limitantes ella y su familia. Actualmente claudia trabaja vendiendo tortillas y a la vez vende fruta es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre vende lo que en el día se propone, lo único que ella desea es obtener los beneficios antes mencionados es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo donde le permitan comprar: ladrillos, arena, el servicio de agua potable y los cables de luz eléctrica. Desea de todo corazón que su sueño se pueda cumplir, así ella podrá vivir en paz ya que no tendrán limitantes para vivir su vida feliz en su hogar.
texts.en:
Claudia, 31, currently lives with her husband and is the mother of a newborn baby.  She lives in a modest house that she owns.  She's a very enterprising and innovative woman who's always known for realizing her goals and objectives.

She has lived in her home for three years and very much wants to be able to improve it because she wants to buy the rights to potable water and electricity.  She also wants to improve her house somewhat so she and her family have no limitations.

Currently Claudia sells tortillas and fruit.  She's a woman who strives and always sells what she plans to in a day.  The only thing she wants is to receive the previously mentioned benefits, so she's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy bricks, sand, potable water service, and electric wiring.

She wants with all her heart for her dream to come true so she can live in peace and have no limitations for living her life happily in her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, potable water service, and electric wiring

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: María Consuelo de 29 años de edad, habita junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos (de 12, 9 y 1 año de edad), es una mujer muy entregada al trabajo que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, luchadora con los que haceres del hogar. Es una mujer con virtudes ya que a pesar de sus limitantes siempre ha salido adelante, ella se dedica a elaborar Comales de barro para comercializar y además cultiva granos básicos, cada mañana se levanta con deseos de superación es por eso que en esta ocasión a solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para mejorar su vivienda ya que es lo que a ella en este momento le interesa. Además para la salud de sus 3 hijos desea tener la conexión para el agua potable, comprar tubos para finalizar la red de tubería, laminas y madera para ampliar una habitación. Desea que su crédito se lleve a cabo ya que no dejara de luchar para que se le cumpla.
texts.en: María Consuelo is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children (aged 12 and 9 and 1 years old). She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She has always been described as offering the best to her children, and as a fighter who is dedicated to her home. She is a woman with many virtues, since despite her limitations, she has always gotten ahead. She makes comales out of clay to sell and also grows basic grains. Every morning she gets to eager to get ahead. That is why on this occasion she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to do some home improvement, which is what she is interested in at this time. In addition, for the health if her 3 children, she wants to have the connection for potable water, buying pipes to finalize the plumbing network, as well as sheeting and wood to enlarge a room. She hopes that her loan will go through and to not stop fighting for this to happen.

loans.use: to buy pipes for potable water, as well as sheeting and wood to enlarge a room.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo es un hombre muy trabajador que a sus 44 años jamas se ha dejado vencer por las dificultades que le presenta la vida. Actualmente vive con su esposa y con sus hijos siempre con el deseo de brindarles lo mejor cada mañana se levanta y emprende su vida laboral tiene muchas características que lo diferencian de los demás es muy simpático, honesto, honrado e inteligente. Gerardo en estos momentos tiene un sueño especifico que es mejorar su vivienda es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, block y hierro y finalizar un muro de su vivienda. Su principal fuente de ingreso es un negocio propio de venta de jarcia que son productos artesanales elaborados de pita como canastos, bolsas, petates, sombreros; con la venta de estos productos él respalda su préstamo y desea que su sueño se cumpla para que su familia tenga una vivienda digna y mejore cada día.
texts.en: Gerardo is a very hardworking man. At 44 years old, he has never let himself be overcome by the difficulties that life has presented. Now he lives with his wife and their children. He always wants to give them the best. Every morning he gets up and starts his work day. He has a lot of characteristics that make him stand out from others. He is kind, honest, honorable and intelligent. At this time, Gerardo has a specific dream, which is improving his home. That is why he is asking FUSAI for  a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, blocks and iron rods to finish a wall for his house. His main source of income is a business he owns selling "jarcia", which are artisanal products made from agave such as baskets, bags, mats, and hats. With the sale of these products, he will backup his loan. He hopes for his dream to come true so that his family will have a dignified life and improve day to day.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sahiaan

texts.en:
Sahiaan is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of milk sales for many years. She sells high quality milk to the people of her community and counts a good client list. 

At present Sahiaan has four buffaloes, four goats and six calves. She is also involved in the work of animal sales to generate extra income. She is very motivated to provide her family a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. 

This is Sahiaan's third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of Kashf. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. In this way her sales will increase, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 54 years old, married, and a very responsible mother to her children. She is very determined to manage her general store well, so it will be able to grow. She works very hard at the store, which she has now had for five years. Earning a daily income of 300 PHP with this business, Nora is able to meet her family everyday needs.  

Nora is asking for 11,000 PHP in additional business capital to further expand her product offerings. If she receives the loan, she will be able to buy various grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and condiments.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and condiments.

loans.name: Amber

texts.en:
Amber is an unmarried 22-year-old woman. She has been in the business of crockery sales for two years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls and more. Her father and brother also assist her by selling products to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 20,000. With this capital, she will be able to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a resultant boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a married, vigorous 50-year-old lady. The man shown in the photo is her son, who has been running a small garment shop nearby his house. 

Parveen’s son buys a wide variety of gentlemen's garments of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates; he then sells them to the people of his community. He has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through his business. 

Parveen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 for her son to buy a wide variety of gentlemen's T-shirts, trousers and jeans in different colors and sizes in order  to attract more customers. Parveen is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of gentlemen's T-shirts, trousers and jeans in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 46-year-old farmer. She is married to Simon, also a farmer, and they are blessed with three children. Margret has been practicing farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

Margret is applying for her second loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy animal feed and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from her farm, she will expand her dairy farming. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 19º del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, esforzándose el doble por ir mejorando la vida de cada una.
Cintia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a  ser manicurista y pedicurista, lo que se debe destacar es el gran empeño que ella pone por salir adelante, siempre también trata de motivar a sus compañeras a ir mejorando día a día, y por medio de las capacitaciones ir dando un hincapié para hacer mejor sus trabajos.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, algodones, alicates y demás, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Activas (Active Women) is in its 19th communal bank cycle. All of them work and help each other to move ahead. They are taking the poverty elimination survey, in which 2 of them are below the poverty line, trying twice as hard to improve their lives.

Cintia is one of the members. She is a manicurist and pedicurist. What should be stressed is the great effort she puts forth in order to move ahead. She also always tries to motivate her fellow group members to improve day after day, and, through the trainings, to place an emphasis on doing their jobs better.

She is asking for this loan to buy nail polish, acetone, cotton balls, nail clippers and other items. This will help her to carry out her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, cotton balls, nail clippers, and other items

loans.name: Maria Carmen Lilian

texts.es: María Carmen Lilian de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella posee una  venta de productos por catalogo y ropa para damas y caballeros, como,  camisas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos entre otros, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, comercia en diferentes tiendas y zonas de la ciudad que calificó como buenas para su trabajo, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque tiene los mejores precios, con producto de calidad, y un servicio  excelente; María es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños, lo más importante en su vida, es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de los miembros, la casa requiere reparaciones específicamente un cambio de techo, desea empezar la labor lo mas pronto posible para mantener la seguridad en su hogar; siempre su mas grande secreto ha sido la perseverancia y la paciencia pues sabe que así alcanzará el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, laminas, arena, algunas herramientas etc. María Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Carmen Lilian is twenty-four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children. She has a business selling products via catalog and men's and women's clothing such as shirts, pants, skirts, dresses and more. She has several years' experience in the business and this has given her the opportunity to always obtain better profits. She sells in different stores and ares of the city that she deemed as good for her work. She has a lot of customers because people prefer her, since she has the best prices with quality products and excellent service. María is a dedicated woman who is willing to give everything of herself to make her dreams come true. The most important thing in her life is her family and in the last few weeks the deterioration of her house has affected her family members' peace of mind. The house needs repairs, specifically with a new roof. She wants to start the work as soon as possible to maintain her home's security. Her biggest secret has been perseverance and patience because she knows that that is how she will attain success. She needs to invest but she doesn't have enough capital and that is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy cement, sheeting, sand, some tools, etc.  María Carmen has good payment references and she is taking responsibility for paying off this debt. She has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheeting, sand, and some tools.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a small-scale garden egg (African fruit) seller in Twifo Prasso (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Adwoa has been working as a garden egg seller for a while now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of garden eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and to ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of garden eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase additional groceries to sell to her customers.

Lolita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Lolita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She got married 5 years ago but still she has not given birth a baby. Her husband is a contractor and constructs buildings on contract. Recently, he was working on a usual contract but suddenly the bricks were in short supply, and the work had to be stopped. He already invested all his savings in the current contract and does not have the money needed to buy the bricks to finish it.

Nadia has requested a loan of 25,000 Rs. so that her husband will be able to buy bricks and finish the contract. With the profit she and her husband make from finishing the work, Nadia will be able to get better treatment from a specialist doctor so that God may bless her with a baby. Nadia hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and she is very thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: to buy bricks for construction.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 46 years old. She lives in the Zestaponi District in Georgia with her large family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law, infant grandson, retired parents-in-law and a brother-in-law. 

Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family's poor living conditions. 

The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They have 7 cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. Besides that, the family cultivates a plot of land where nuts are grown. They own a vineyard as well. The harvested products are sold at the local open market, but the income is hardly enough for food and every day expenses for an eight-person family. 

Nino requested a loan from Credo, Kiva's field partner, to start up a family business and build a greenhouse. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages a provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to vulnurable poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they're regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan, Nino will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Nino will grow greens and various types of vegetables. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ginna

texts.en:
Ginna is 46 years old and married with two children.

Ginna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household products like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, coffee and other items.

Ginna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ginna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household products like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, egg, coffee and other items.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 42-year-old married woman. Two years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. 

She buys wide range of clothes from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them to the people of her locality. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She is a mother of four children and is trying hard to fulfill the demands of her family. 

She has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales and wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide a good, quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace sells cooked rice in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). She has been educated up to the end of junior high school. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Grace has been working in this enterprise for eight years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels of rice. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her cooked rice enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of rice

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a 40-year-old from Olkalou. She is single with one child who is 12 years old.

She does mixed farming and has been in this occupation for the past three years. She has applied for a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET after repaying the previous one successfully. She intends to use the new loan to buy a dairy cow. 

Jemima's hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: María, que está ubicada en el medio de la fotografía, es de tez blanca y pelo rubio, esta con un abrigo negro con puntos blancos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Candelaria, que está ubicado en Concepción VIII región de Chile. En este Banco hay distintos rubro los cuales son venta de ropa, de verduras cortinas de baño, cojines. María tiene su negocio en donde ella confecciona y vende cortinas de baño, ropa de colegio, cojines y manteles. Aprendió en un liceo técnico, del cual salió hace 30 años aproximadamente, y también ha participado en distintos talleres de confección. Lo que más problemas le ha traído a su negocio ha sido la falta de dinero para seguir manteniéndolo. Ella espera para poder ocupar el préstamo en comprar insumos para su trabajo que son hilos, telas, blondas. Espera que le vaya muy bien, ya que ha pesar de no tener dinero para comprar los insumos mucha gente le ha hecho encargos y ella solo espera contar con el dinero para empezar. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder participar en Fon Esperanza es el hecho de contar con una excelente asesora de Banco Comunal, quien es una persona muy amable y preocupada por todas las personas del Banco Comunal, además de contar con un muy buen grupo de personas.
texts.en: María belongs to the Candelaria communal bank located in the Concepción VIII region of Chile. She is in the middle of this photograph, with white skin and blonde hair and a black raincoat with white dots. The members of the bank do different types of work such as selling clothing, vegetables, shower curtains, and cushions. María has a business making and selling shower curtains, school uniforms, cushions, and tablecloths. She learned the work at a technical high school, from which she graduated approximately 30 years ago, and she has also worked at different tailoring businesses. What has given her business the most trouble is the lack of money to keep it going. She hopes to be able to use the loan to buy supplies for her work, which are thread, fabric, and lace. She hopes that it goes very well for her, since despite not having money to buy the supplies, many people have ordered from her and she is only waiting to have the money to start. What she has liked most about being able to participate in Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they have an excellent communal bank advisor who is a very kind person who cares about all the people in the communal bank, as well as having a very good group of people.

loans.use: to buy fabric and lace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as focused and determined.  He has taken a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members.  This will enable them to keep enough safe water for domestic use.  He runs a barbershop to earn a living.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loans were successfully repaid.  His hopes and dreams are to grow economically and socially.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for higher education fees.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is married with 3 children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Currently, Afia sells bread and cakes in Twifo Prasso (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 10 years now. Her husband is a driver. Afia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Afia will use the loan to increase her existing bread and cake capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Afia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing bread and cake capacity

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is a small-scale baker in Twifo Prasso, near Cape Coast.  She has had formal education through the 6th grade.  She is married to a carpenter and has 4 children.  Yaa has been working as a baker for close to 15 years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and to pay for their children’s school fees.  She plans on using her loan to purchase additional bread in order to meet rising customer demands.  She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a baking stand.  This will help her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This marks Susan's second borrowing to finance her butcher shop business. She will use the requested loan to purchase white and red meat for her butchery, given that this is the Muslim festive season. Her business is doing well and has been servicing her loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy meat for her butchery

loans.name: Safaida

texts.en:
Safaida is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing the store's stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Safaida is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 24-year-old single man who lives in the city of Ibb, Yemen. He is involved in sales. He leases a space where he opened a phone accessories business. He started his business with a small amount of capital repairing mobile phones, and then he developed his business to open a phone accessories shop. 

Salah intends to expand his business, but his saved amount is not enough. He is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy phone accessories and related goods in order to increase his capital. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and related goods.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
After graduating Class Six, Yaa decided to set up her own bread and drink business in Twifo Praso (near Cape Coast). 

With a number of years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. Therefore, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more ingredients to make bread and drinks for resale. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a driver, with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her to purchase more ingredients to make bread and drinks for resale

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and a mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer and his income is not enough to fulfill household expenditures alone. So one year ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. 

Shehnaz buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates; she then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to expand her inventory and attract more customers.  

She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history.  She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya,a very fertile area for agriculture production. He is married and has four children. He has practiced farming for 25 years. His main source of income is milk, bananas and tea, which he sells in the local market.

He has requested a loan of.42,000 KES for purchasing a dairy cow which will increase milk production. Dairy farming is a very marketable area and thus his income base will increase due to increase in production. This loan will help him to improve his family's living standards. His major challenge is lack of a good market for his products. In five years time, he wants to specialize in dairy farming.

Wilson says that Juhudi Kilimo has affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 40-year-old married woman. She is happily doing business in shoe making with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She beautifully makes shoes in different colors, designs and sizes at home, and then her husband sells them in the local market at reasonable prices. By this time, they have attained a regular list of customers and make enough to earn income for the family. To cope with the increasing demand of their customers, Shazia requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors to increase her production. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes with more spools of threads in various colors

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a 26-year-old shop retailer and the owner of a motorcycle used for transportation in Mariakani Kenya. She is a married mother of three children.who has been in business for the last four years and has done great with the support of her husband.

This marks her fourth loan to finance her business from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to purchase inventory of wheat and maize flour, sugar, milk, cooking fat and paraffin. She hopes to expand her business and own several motorbikes in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, milk, cooking fat and paraffin

loans.name: Mwendee

texts.en: Mwendee lives in Malindi Kenya where she runs a business. She buys scrap metal items and sells to companies that recycle the items in to usable products. She also has a charcoal business that she does to improve her income. She is a wife and a mother of six children. Her major target is to be selling a lorry full of scrap metal in the next five years. One limiting factor that she has to deal with is financing. The other challenge that she faces is harrassment by the authorities while transporting the products. She found Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy scrap iron sheets, disposed wire and empty containers. The income that she will raise will go towards paying school fees for her children. This will also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy scrap iron sheets, disposed wire and empty containers

loans.name: Madiha

texts.en: Madiha, age 34, is an energetic married woman. She is actively involved in the business of flower selling for many years. She purchases stock of different flowers and after making garlands she sells them in her community. She also gets orders for events like weddings and birthdays and earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine and lilies with some reels of white thread. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and will generate more revenue. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine and lilies with some reels of white thread

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of envelope making for many years. She makes a large quantity of envelopes in different sizes at home and sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Razia requested a loan of 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper with some glue and floral tapes to increase her sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good loan history. She expects an increase in her business income and wishes to spend a part of the profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper with some glue and floral tape

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 43-year-old married father of three children. To earn his living, he owns a small grocery shop where he sells the best kind of vegetables and fruits, and has been working in this field for three years now. 

However, in order to register his pickup to use it for transporting his fruits and vegetables from the wholesale market, he has to legalize his business and secure it into the government's papers. So, he contacted Al Majmoua and decided to acquire the loan that would support him in covering the fees of registration. Therefore, this will allow him to purchase merchandise in big quantities and at lower costs, which will lead to increasing his profit.

loans.use: to pay his pickup's and company's registeration fees

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 3 and a half years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a driver and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. That is why Shehnaz is working hard to contribute in the family income.  She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to increase her business, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates for resale. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase water pumps and pipes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married lady aged 46 years old.  Her spouse is a business man and adds income to the family.  They are blessed with 3 children aged 18, 13 and 5 years old.  She runs a hotel business in Kampi Ya Moto location and has been in operation for over a period of 3 years earning an income of 20,000 KES.

She has borrowed her second loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD., which she intends to use to purchase utensils and other equipment that will enable her to boost her business.  The profits she will earn will be used to reinvest in to the business.

She hopes for growth in her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and utensils for her business

loans.name: Maritza Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, a sus 29 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo y vive con sus padres. Por falta de oportunidades laborales, ella decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece mecato, gaseosas y muchos productos de la canasta familiar, el negocio está ubicado en un pequeño salón de la casa de sus padres y allí ha logrado posicionarse en el sector donde reside durante los dos años que lleva de funcionamiento; de esta manera ella ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hijo y para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Andrea es una mujer guerrera, luchadora, emprendedora y con ganas de progresar, por ello solicita el crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, gaseosas, productos lácteos, productos de aseo, entre otros) con el fin de ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y aumentar así las ventas y por ende los ingresos, además podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta, que es tener su negocio bien posicionado y que sea perdurable en el tiempo, así podrá lograr una estabilidad económica que le permitirá fortalecer la economía de su hogar y brindará un mejor bienestar y educación a su hijo.
texts.en: Andrea is 29 years old. She is unmarried and has a son; they live with her parents. Because of the lack of job opportunities in her area, she has decided to go into business on her own and set up a grocery store where she sells pastries, soft drinks, and many staple goods. The business is in a small room in her parents' house, and she has been successful in the area over the last two years of running the business. Andrea is a determined, hardworking woman with initiative and a desire to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to support her business and plans to use it to purchase goods (pastries, soft drinks, dairy products, cleanings products, and so on) so she can offer her customers more variety and increase her sales. Increasing her income will help her reach her ultimate goal, which is to have a successful long-term business that will provide financial stability and allow her to contribute to the household and offer her son a better life and education.

loans.use: to purchase goods (pastries, soft drinks, dairy products, cleanings products, and so on).

loans.name: Alba Leticia

texts.es: Alba Leticia de veinticuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, específicamente el güisquil, tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro y siembre obtiene buenas cosechas, que le han dado la oportunidad de mantener  las mejores ganancias, el terreno de siembra es adecuado y fértil y está ubicado en un lugar que calificó como bueno para su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque vende las mejores hortalizas de la zona además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio es inigualable; Alba es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus metas, lo más importante para ella es su familia por eso trabaja duro para darles lo mejor, está preocupada pues su vivienda está un poco pequeña y eso ha incomodado a todos en el hogar, la casa necesita la construcción de un cuarto para lograr mas espacio y quiere realizarlas lo más pronto posible para la comodidad de todos. Su más grande secreto es la motivación de salir adelante, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito; necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, herramientas etc. Alba Leticia es conocida en el lugar por su buena paga, se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 24-year-old Alba Leticia lives with her partner. She makes a living by planting vegetables, specifically chayote. She has several years of experience in this and she always has good harvests, which have given her the opportunity to have the best profits.
